results.description:
*************************************

NOTICE - Please support our donation drive to pay for our group's yearly Meetup fees.  Donation info and instructions... http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/messages/boards/thread/49619820

*************************************

UPDATE... @@@ HAPPY APRIL FOOL'S DAY!!!@@@


We are the NYC ASIANS MEETUP who are not only foodies, explorers, intellects, adventure seekers, and adrenaline seekers but we go where NO Asian man or Asian woman has gone.  Let's break the barriers once again and lead a day hunting the infamous BIG FOOT aka Sasquatch!!!

Over the years many have attempted to view or hunt for Big Foot even many in our Tri-State area.  But none have been a group of Asians.  Let's break the status quo and become the first Asians to hunt Big Foot - at least for a day in the Catskills.

I have done some research over recent years and it seems in Asia - locals attract the Yeti with local goats as well as local human foods including Mongolian and Chinese delights.  Thus being that the Big Foot are close relatives of the Yeti, my thoughts are not only should we bring some Chinese, Korean, and Japanese eats for ourselves but we can also use the foods to lure Big Foot!   Who doesn't like a tasty roast pork bun, Xia Long Bao, Banh Mi, Kimchi, or sashimi?  Even Big Foot would!

Bring food, water, dress in layers as this will be a early morning trip into the day.  Make sure everyone bring recording devices and binoculars as well.  Do not wear perfumes, deodorant, Tiger Balm, or any other scented agents.  Place cell phones on silent mode.

Carpools will be set up once we have drivers.  $15 per NYC passenger paid to drivers.

Exact State Park or Area To Be Determined - most likely the Catskills area.

Bigfoot, also known as Sasquatch, is an alleged humanoid creature said to inhabit remote forests in the United States and Canada. It is considered to be a cryptozoological creature and is often described as being a large, bipedal animal. It is said that it's relatives can be found around the world with such names as the Yeti, the Yeren, the Almas, the Yowie and many more. Bigfoot is one of the most famous examples of cryptozoology, but is not well supported in the scientific community.

http://www.bigfoothunting.com/

http://bigfootfinder.com/resources/the-bigfoot-hunters-essential-shopping-checklist/

http://www.bfro.net/news/roundup/expeds_2016.asp

http://www.hvmag.com/core/pagetools.php?pageid=9554&url=%2FHudson-Valley-Magazine%2FJune-2012%2FSearching-for-Bigfoot-Bigfoot-Sightings-in-Upstate-NY-Discovery-Channels-Finding-Bigfoot%2F&mode=print

http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2011/08/as_bigfoot_sasquatch_or_njs_bi.html

For this trip - THE DISCLAIMER IS VERY IMPORTANT - Please read!

DISCLAIMER:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
Join us for coffee, networking and a great interactive morning with April Jaffe, business-growth consultant and CEO of Raise Your Game.

This is a workshop where you will get an introduction to the concepts and principles of improv as they relate to and impact everything you do in business, from presentation skills to closing more sales.

Learn how to present and sell with confidence and clarity to resonate with your audience. April will guide you through a series of interactive exercises followed by discussion providing the perfect training ground for new ways of thinking that can transform your business. 

You'll have the rare opportunity to practice skills and learn from each other in a safe and non-threatening environment. We promise, you'll walk away with a heightened awareness of yourself, and experience renewed energy and excitement, equipped with the tools needed to begin growing your business.

This is a unique workshop you won't want to miss! Please join us on April 1st—with "April" : )

April Jaffe is a dynamic sales and marketing consultant. Her experience and insight will guide you to make effective changes needed to increase your business. Learn how to raise your game and succeed in this competitive market.  

Just a few offerings at Raise Your Game: 

Sales Training

Learn sales strategies and skills to bring in new business: questioning strategies, active listening, building a rapport, and how to get to close that deal.

Successful Conference Calls

Learn how to stay in control of important conversations through active listening and collaboration so calls become less awkward.

Negotiating

Master the aspects of negotiating techniques including developing personas for your clients and potential clients.

Presentations

Learn how to make an impact on your audiences and how to prepare for  potential client curveballs .

Networking

Practice being fearless and confident so you can strike up conversations anywhere, anytime, with anyone. Learn follow-up techniques for building your professional network.
results.name: Using Improv to Strengthen Your Sales and Presentation Skills

results.description:
NYASA’S 41st conference is historic on all levels. It is the first time we will present the theme of Music and the Arts and a first time collaboration between The City College (CUNY), Columbia University, and the organization. It is also the first time the conference will present live performances, film screenings, and exhibitions.

Music and the Arts of Africa and the Diaspora are defined in their totality, including all types of performance, visual, and mediatized cultural forms from within their traditional contexts to their contemporary manifestations. The conference will focus on broad themes within these genres such as spirituality, religion, politics, expressive culture, literature, languages, gender, science, health, identity, nationalism, and Pan-Africanism.

NYASA 2016 welcomes proposals for presentations, panels, posters, roundtables, and plenary sessions that focus on topics which include (but are not limited to) the following: (check their website for all the topics, and ways to become a member. I'm not sure about the time - it's a 2 day conference but the schedule is not up, so I just put 9 a.m.. More info when it becomes available. So who wants to write a paper???) http://newyorkafricanstudiesassociation.org/

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we have the pleasure of having Shayne Veramallay come and share his journey. (Special thanks to Chad Than for the intro)

Shayne Veramallay is the Global Head and Senior Executive of DLA Piper's Accelerate Advisory Group and Venture Pipeline.

Shayne works with the firm’s emerging growth clients to refine business strategies, manage their fundraising process, and foster growth initiatives through M&A, strategic partnerships, and international expansion.  He rapidly analyzes “deal potential” and works with management to take to market by scrutinizing various  aspects of their business plans, execution strategies, and financial models. He also works directly with the investment community, including angels, seed, early stage, growth and buyout funds, to align investors’ specific investment criteria with our corresponding deal flow.

Shayne’s background before joining DLA Piper centered around finance and operations.  He started out his career on Wall Street as a private equity placement agent for Salomon Smith Barney’s Investment Banking Division.  From there, he pursued a career in venture capital, where he was a Principal with NJTC Venture Fund ($100mm early stage fund) and was responsible for investing nearly 60% of the portfolio with a focus on clean tech, advanced materials, life sciences, education, and information technology. 

Following his venture tenure, he spent several years on the operating side, including Hycrete, Inc. to head business development and sustainability, iLevel Solutions as Director of Analytics, and JP Morgan as a Senior Business Analyst and Project Lead for FinTech integration into the firm’s Private Equity Alternative Investment Services unit.

Shayne attended Indiana University’s Kelley School of Business (magna cum laude) and studied Finance and International Business.  He is an avid cyclist and swimmer and has a deep passion for classic automobiles and motorcycles.

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you then!

results.description:
We're still working our way through Mark Seemann's Type-Driven Development with F# class. We have 1.5 hours scheduled and will be able to make it through the fourth and fifth modules -- Stabilizing Transitions and Stabiling Execution, listed below -- plus have some discussion afterwards! 

Description

Learn how to use the strong type system of F# to your advantage – not only to check for correctness, but also in iterative development with short feedback cycles. You can use the type system to get rapid feedback about design ideas and implementation details, but also to get guidance on what to do next. Due to F#’s strong type inference, the type system of the language can be used in ways not available in C#, Java, or similar strongly typed languages. Learn how to combine the safety of static typing with the ease of development typically only offered by dynamically typed languages. The combination though, is even stronger than the mere sum of its parts.

About Mark

Mark Seemann is a Danish programmer based in Copenhagen, Denmark. His professional interests include object-oriented development, functional programming, and software architecture, as well as software development in general. Apart from writing a book about Dependency Injection he has also written numerous articles and blog posts about related topics.

Despite being a .NET programmer he takes most of his inspiration from sources across a wide range of technologies, including lots of pattern books.

Originally poised to become a rock star or (failing that) graphic novelist (in the European tradition) he one day found himself with insufficient talent for either, a master’s degree in Economics, and a desire for working with computers. He has been doing the latter intermittently since 1995.

When not working with software or spending time with his family, Mark enjoys reading, drawing and painting, listening to and playing music, as well as preparing or consuming gourmet food and wine.

You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of." After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Register" button, then the yellow "Continue" button under "2016 Winter Programs, and follow the prompts. To register, you will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) You will be able to pay the $40 fee online, as well. If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at <a>[masked]</a> or email [masked].  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL 10!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class:  Care and Coordination 

Review & New:  All of our activities involve care and coordination.  These skills are major precepts of a Montessori classroom.  Some, however, require more!

Activities:  Variations will keep coming; new water transfer activity will be introduced; and we'll try a stencil, too.

Adult Learning:   Does it drive you crazy that your child selects the same tray of work every class? Does (s)he ask you to read the same book over and over and over again? Let's talk about it!

A Peek Ahead:  After the first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a melon baller, pouring

Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing

Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eyedropper, clothespins

results.description:
Design is the critical component of a successful email campaign, but email design has its own unique set of challenges that many designers aren’t even aware of.

Audiences are reading and interacting with email on many different devices with varying screen sizes. How do you design a compelling message for so many varied experiences? What are the responsive coding issues that you’ll face?

This seminar will help clarify the design process for you. We will look at how design impacts an email campaign’s success rates, design limitations, and methods for turning these limitations into strengths. You will come away with an understanding of the best practices for designing email that looks great on both desktop and mobile.

In this 2-hour seminar you’ll learn the following:

The ideal balance of text & images
Designing on a grid
Ideal widths for your designs
Coding necessary to make your email responsive
Typography & choosing fonts
Emphasizing readability
Best practices for handling images that do not load automatically
Compelling clickthroughs & calls to action
How your design may change in difficult clients, such as Outlook and Gmail for Mobile

RSVP

https://www.nobledesktop.com/seminars?register_for=133
results.name: Responsive Email

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Sugarbush Resort


Sugarbush, located in Northern Vermont's Mad River Valley, is one of Vermont's favortie ski areas. Sugarbush consits of two mountains, Mt. Ellen and Lincoln Peak, and is home to more than 4,000 acres, with nearly 600 skiable acres plus 2,000 acres of backcountry skiing in the Slide Brook Wilderness area. "The 'Bush" has beginner terrain (20%), Intermediate (45%) and advanced to expert (35%) accessed via 16 lifts that provide the area with a 25,463 person uphill capacity. The 23,000 square-foot day lodge features cathedral ceilings, a food court, and the Castlerock Pub complete with an outdoor patio and barbeque area. Timbers, a post-and-beam restaurant attached to the Clay Brook residences, offers upscale cuisine and is open to the public in all four seasons. The Mad River Valley is also home to 38 lodges (6,600 beds) and 19 restaurants for guests to enjoy.


Snow Creek (Closest Condo to the slopes)


These two-bedroom, a sleep sofa, two-bath stacked units are the most conveniently located and are slope-side at the base of Lincoln Peak. 6 persons will share each unit and each person will share a bed. These units offer a fully equipped kitchen, color cable television, fireplace, washer dryer, and balcony. During the summer months, enjoy the conveniently located on-site pool at the Snow Creek complex.


*** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***


Date/Time: April 1st Friday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.


Depart 4:00 PM from Queens: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map) 

Depart 5:00 PM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 5:50 PM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17 - In front of parking garage entrance) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map) $2-$4 daily parking at the parking garage.

Return: Depart from Sugarbush at 3:30 PM on Sunday, & get back to NJ around 8:45 PM, NYC 9:30 PM and Flushing 10:00 PM.

Trip Includes: 2 nights accommodation at Snow Creek based on 6 persons sharing two-bedroom & a sleep sofa unit and 2 persons sharing a bed (Ski-In Ski-Out). 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Sugarbush. Round trip Benz Sprinter van transportation from NYC & Flushing.

Cost: Early Birds $279 for first 10 spots; Regular $309 for last 10 spots. Self drive is $60 less. Also, additional $60 reduction for drivers for giving each passenger & their equipment/luggage a ride.

Additional Cost: 2 day Rental (skis or snowboard) is group rate $75; Group Lesson at $60.

Max: 20

Buy Ticket Here: http://apr2016sugarbush.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) When Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Refund Policy:


* Full refund minus $30 processing fee if cancelled 21 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 10 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 10 days; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $30 processing fee.

Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
Dear Philosophers,

This meetups on every other Friday will be dedicated to contemporary Continental Philosophy and a new way of philosophy of the 21 century. At our first introduction meeting on Friday, April 1, from 4-7 pm, we will define the most interesting topics for future discussions. For a warm-up we will review some ideas of Existentialism of Jean-Paul Sartre/ Martin Heidegger and French post-structuralist thinkers like Jacques Derrida, Michel Foucault and Gilles Deleuze. According to Sartre, Existentialism is the belief that “existence precedes essence.” That is to say that human creation differs from the production of objects, because objects are manufactured with a pre-determined purpose or “essence” in mind, while humans are created and then determine their own meaning through existence (choices and actions). As Sartre puts it, “Man is nothing other than what he makes of himself.

There will be free wine, cheese, and plenty of intellectual pleasure. 

After this event, we scheduled another discussion about "Perspective of Mind Uploading"or possibility of whole brain emulation (WBE) followed by a reception. 

I am happy to announce that after our Continental meeting, the expert in Whole Brain Emulation Dr. Randal A. Koene and psychologist Dr. Jay Friedenberg will lead parts of the talk on Mind Uploading. That mean a deep fruitful conversation and fun. 


Neuroscientists have stated that important functions performed by the mind, such as learning, memory, and consciousness, are due to purely physical and electrochemical processes in the brain and are governed by applicable laws. They believe that a consciousness is a product of our neurons network and does not arise from “some magical or otherworldly quality”. We will discuss this topic and if a human brain is just a “way station” or the final destination of the consciousness. Also, will review a current technology approaching to mind uploading. So, you are very welcome to attend this later meetup as well.

Our large classroom with kitchen, wifi ect. is located in SoHo at 594 Broadway, Suite 402, New York, NY 10012 Please contact me for any questions [masked]

A one-hour tasting introduction to state-changing botanical elixirs sourced from the best ingredients around the world.

$20 tickets on line
$25 tickets at the door
Purchase tickets here: https://hourofhappiness.splashthat.com/

Doors open at 5pm. *Make sure to allot one hour to do the full flight*

We like to think of ourselves as disrupting the social drinking scene.

Be the first to explore a new generation of state-changing imbibables that don’t rely on alcohol to change your state: relaxing your body, heightening your senses, opening your heart, and energizing your being. Discover plants that were once a Soviet military secret, reverse your graying hair, and make bears (or you) lick each other for hours. We combine scientific crafting with indigenous wisdom traditions to bring you a new world of extraordinary whole plant elixirs and tonics that change your state, benefit your body and enrich your being. WHY PLANTS?

Inspired by indigenous shamanic practices, our shared connection with the planet we inhabit, and the common threads between global wisdom traditions, we believe in the "alchemical" power of plants to help us move into greater awareness and bring conscious intention to our lives.

results.description:
We're thrilled to have Jared Tate, President of DigiByte, the third most traded cryptocurrency, visit us from Hong Kong.   Mr. Tate is in NYC this week after presenting at FinDEVr NYC, the only FinTech for developers conference. 

DigiByte is a scalable blockchain ecosystem with  components including gaming and shopping.  Mr. Tate comes from the Mid West with a farming background.  He also is a West Point Grad with both personal training and aviation certifications in addition to expertise in eSports.  He discovered bitcoin and blockchain a few years ago and has not looked back.   His presentation will include:


- Intro to blockchain/cryptocurrency

- DigiByte overview

- Personal background including the entrepreneurial experience

- International alterna-currency and FinTech ecosystem

-Q&A + more

About DigiByte & The Speaker:  DigiByte is a rapidly growing worldwide decentralized blockchain and digital currency used in 82+ countries. Jared has been involved with Bitcoin since 2012. In the Fall of 2013, he decided to make several improvements to the Bitcoin core protocol which culminated in the launch of DigiByte on January 10th, 2014. With DigiByte’s most recent DigiSpeed hard fork, DigiByte is capable of 300 transactions per second and is scalable to match Visa's transaction speed by 2021. By 2035, DigiByte will be capable of handling over 200k transactions per second. DigiByte enhancements have been used by multiple other digital currencies including Dogecoin. 

Mr. Tate's company, DigiByte Holdings Limited, is focused on millennial consumer acquisition solutions built upon the DigiByte blockchain and leverages these users as a gateway for institutional investors and companies to also utilize the blockchain to reach these markets. DigiByte also uses the security properties of blockchain technology to provide auditing and secure data platforms for consumers and companies alike.
results.name: Blockchain Intro + Business With Founder of DigiByte, CryptoCurrency

results.description:
Bring your laptop! 

We're using the Flatiron School's online Full Stack Web Development program, starting with the free Intro to Ruby Development track. We highly recommend that you create your account and get your feet wet with the platform before you arrive! 

We'll start by socializing and getting to know everyone and then we'll all jump into Learn at whatever point in the curriculum we are (there will be a wide range of levels present including total newbie!). Collaboration and questions are encouraged.

All levels welcome! Positivity and friendliness required. :-)

RingCentral: https://meetings.ringcentral.com/j/1499103657
results.name: Full Stack Social Study Group - Flatiron School

group.name: Learn Code in NYC (Flatiron School Study Groups)

results.description: We made it to another Spring, with warm events coming our way. Our next event will be at the Carnegie Club, one of the nicest cigar lounges in the city. With it's throwback look, a great way to relax for a cocktail & cigar. I do suggest to bring your own cigars & take the cutting fee. They do have a nice selection of cigars but very pricey. A very good size lounge with a bi level. A great place to bring a guest or date. Waitress service & a food menu is available. This will be on a Friday night and at 9:00 they do have a live jazz band with a no charge policy. We have used this place many times and they are very attentive to our group.  If you are a new member, a great event to start off with and meet your fellow smokers. We do encourage you to bring guests , as always. So don't get Fool! this year, and come out and enjoy a wonderful evening. I'll be waiting!
results.name: April Fool Cigar Meet!

results.how_to_find_us: Walk past the bar to the back of the ground floor. Cute tables, nice people, and even French servers from time to time.

group.name: "The New York South Asian Social Group"

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
Let's Get Social and Have FUN = True BLISS!!

We're mixing it up and hanging out at the very cool, Cafe' Serai in the Rubin Museum of Art. The energy of the Bliss seekers who show up fully, mixed with the energy of the Rubin are worth the visit. So inspiring!!! Great way to turn around a stressful week, celebrate a joyful one and make new friends!

COME FOR PART OR ALL OF THE EVENING!

This is one of my VERY FAVORITE places to gather in NYC.
If you have never been you will love it:
* The food is yummy-eclectic
* Happy hour = 2:1 house drinks, 6:00 - 7:00 pm
* There's a DJ (music, not dance)
* Museum is FREE on Fridays (tour @ 7pm) with an awesome collection of Himalayan and Nepalese art, and spirit-inspiring spaces (like the Tibetan Shrine room exhibit.

Check out the website to learn more about the activities: http://www.rubinmuseum.org
NOTE: Fridays are busy, so come early and get your food & drinks.

NATURAL NETWORKING: It is well known that people hire you because they "know, like and trust" you. In this atmosphere, it is easy to relax, be yourself and authentically attractive. This is about personal connection! Try to avoid the dreaded & boring "what do you do?" question. How about, "What's your passion?" to get a real conversation started, and find out how/if you and the other person resonate.

Come to have FUN, but bring your business cards in case someone wants to connect with you or learn more about you and what you bring to the world by way of your business. Many profitable connections have already grown from these events, e.g., new clients, great resources, support networking and much more.

It's great to mix business with retreat & mindfulness. Playtime is key to creativity and productivity. It's also a great way to nurture natural networking & nurture creative soul.

I look forward to meeting you for the first time, reconnecting and enjoying food, fun and drinks (alcoholic or non)

From my heart to yours,
results.name: [Social Bliss] Fun & Fabulous Evening Mixer (Natural Networking) FREE

group.name: Business Bliss - NYC Mindful Mastermind & Natural Networking

results.description:
Mark Anthony Jenkins 49th Birthday Celebration


 This is a New York Black Entrepreneurs Network, New York Black Expo and New York Metro Black Chamber of Commerce special exclusive networking and business card exchange event and birthday salute for Mark Anthony Jenkins @ Red Rooster for family, friends, founders, entrepreneurs, business owners, investors, dreamers, doers, business professionals and startup professionals. 

Come celebrate my final year in the 40's. Toasting a glass of wine to my final year of 49. (Next year I promise we will party for my 50th Birthday All Black Affair Celebration) Calling all Family and Friends for a nice evening of networking, mingling followed by dinner. The Red Rooster contacted me to host my birthday celebration downstairs followed by dinner for just a small group of us. If you are joining us for dinner please RSVP by calling me at[masked] and remember to bring your credit card/cash because we pay together as a group. If you are not joining us for dinner we will patronize the bar while we are networking and mingling throughout the night.


 6pm to 10pm: Professional Networking Mixer and Mingling


 9:30pm to 11pm: Dinner for up to 10 people (call[masked] to RSVP)
results.name: Mark Anthony Jenkins 49th Birthday Celebration (Dinner, Networking & Mingling)

Blues Jam

"

https://vine.co/v/h26XTIzVWeH

"

For beginners and intermediate players. (We are a very supportive crowd!)

We will warm up by strumming along to great songs then go over blues licks and jam!

BYOB Jam; Hang Out, Drink and Play!

Blues Jam Made Easy; work on pentatonic scales and seventh chords.

This will be a guided blues jam with room for improvement on all levels of playing.

Acoustic guitars are provided. There are a few amps for electric guitars if you bring yours.

Bass players are welcome (bring your own bass)

Ukelele players are welcome (bring your own uke)

results.description:
"Superheroes in Gotham," an exhibit at the New-York Historical Society, tells the story of the birth of comic book superheroes in New York City; the leap of comic book superheroes from the page into radio, television, and film; the role of fandom, including the yearly mega event known as New York Comic Con; and the ways in which comic book superheroes, created in the late 1930s through the 1960s, have inspired and influenced the work of contemporary comic book artists, cartoonists, and painters in New York City.

Friday night is pay-as-you-wish after 6 p.m.

results.description:
Ashok Jain Gallery is pleased to announce, Joie de Vivre, a solo exhibition of Rosanne Ebner at 58 Hester Street. Opening on Wednesday, March 30, the exhibition is the presentation of a fountain which is an exquisite ceramic sculpture. 

“Joie De Vivre pays homage to the natural world, representing the power of regeneration through nourishment and the ability to procreate instead of consuming through greed. The neglect of today’s world is ruining the balance of a deeply symbiotic relationship with nature. This disconnection needs to be addressed so we can revive the relationship with our natural world and safeguard the future survival of the species.”
- Rosanne Ebner

Rosanne studied at Syracuse University, Adelphi University, and Queens College, and had number of exhibitions including recent shows at Adelphi University, Briarcliff College, and Celadon Gallery.
Teaching as an instructor at Nassau Community College, the artist continued her works representing the different stages of womanhood in satirical way by combining the organic form of the figure with the geometric forms of architecture. Rosanne is presently an instructor at Brickhouse Ceramic Art Center.

On her solo exhibition Joie de Vivre, Rosanne reflects her attraction to natural world and further explores the meaning of relationship between nature and us.

The reception for Joie de Vivre, will be on Friday, April 1,[masked]- 8 PM.
results.name: Joie de Vivre

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6:00 - Start. Stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
6:30 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
7:30 - Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the center table.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time!

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time. If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
Ashok Jain Gallery is pleased to announce, Fine Art Photo Exhibit, a group exhibition of artworks by four photographers – Matt Vescovo, Marlene Luce Tremblay, Andrea Laybauer, and Barry Udis - at 58 Hester Street. Opening on Wednesday, March 30, the exhibition is the presentation of fine art photography. 

Andrea Laybauer creates sound sculptures to enable invisibility to be visible, whereas Barry Udis’ inspiration comes from natural world. These works of the artists are the result of laborious process to capture a beautiful moment, the very moment that you may never able to capture again. Using pintography, Marlene Luce Tremblay reflects her conversation with the world she lives in. Through tinted cityscapes, the artist visualizes her dream of a world filled with love and joy. Meanwhile, Matt Vescovo comes up with very different intention and style which strongly engages the viewers. The artist audaciously proclaims to be the ‘stock photobomber’ to satire on artificial imagery, and comes up with photographs that breaks that pretense. 

The reception for Fine Art Photo Exhibit will be on Friday, April 1, 2016.
results.name: April Fool's Photo Exhibition

results.description:
Join us in downtown Manhattan at Women's eNews as we explore the themes of this provocative and timely documentary, The Sixty-Six Percent.

The Event
A documentary screening followed by a panel discussion regarding the film's content with industry leaders and stakeholders.

The Movie
The Sixty-Six Percent is about women in the U.S. - the overwhelming majority of which are overweight (66%) according to the CDC, thus considered "plus-size" by the fashion industry, yet are treated as the minority in women's wear. The film explores the annual event, Full-Figured Fashion Week, which seeks to counteract the normative behavior that has been perpetuated by New York Fashion Week in continuing to drape society's belief in beauty as being an unattainable fantasy.

Website: thesixtysixpercent.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/thesixtysixpercent
Twitter: @the66percent
Instagram: @thesixtysixpercent
Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/thesixtysixpercent

The Filmmaker
Natalie Abruzzo is a TV reporter, multi-media journalist and filmmaker in New York. She recently earned her master’s degree at the CUNY Graduate School of Journalism where she studied broadcast journalism with a concentration in health and science. Natalie spent 2015 simultaneously working as an on-air reporter for ABC and CBS in the Twin Tiers area of New York State and completing her first documentary short, “The Sixty-Six Percent.” She is currently traveling around the Tri-state area talking with audiences about her documentary short to engage in a broader conversation about the disparities between women’s clothing sizes, body shapes and cultural norms.

Drinks and Snack will be provided!

There are a limited number of seats. Please use the link to RSVP for tickets.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-sixty-six-percent-a-conversation-about-culture-perceptions-and-consumers-tickets-23195600666?utm-medium=discovery&utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-source=cp&utm-term=listing

Any questions? Contact [masked]
results.name: The Sixty-Six Percent: A Conversation About Culture, Perceptions & Consumers

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.

Please join us for an evening of networking, discussion, food, and drinks regarding our summer edition of Civic Art Lab 2016. 

We will discuss our upcoming summer project. This year's theme is climate change education. 

Our group, GREENSPACENYC, is a non-profit collaborative that develops and curates free educational programming, hands-on workshops, and public design projects that encourage dialogue, enliven public spaces, and promote the future of a more equitable and sustainable city.

CIVIC ART LAB 2016
Civic Art Lab is a community design and sustainability project in NYC. We are currently developing our 2016 lab. We are seeking volunteer artists, designers, and instructors to lead workshops. 

CIVIC ART LAB 2015
Our 2015 lab was developed in collaboration with the Bridge Street Development Corporation’s Pop-up Program. This environmental, art and design, and educational initiative called on neighbors to share skills and showcase recent cultural and environmental initiatives happening locally. The goal is to amplify diverse voices and encourage future community engagement. Between July and August 2015 we offered forty free workshops. 

We look forward to seeing you! Space is limited. As a courtesy to our host, a one drink minimum is required.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

Class description: SALSA is a popular form of social dance that originated in New York City with strong influences from Latin America, particularly Puerto Rico, Cuba, and Colombia. The movements of salsa have origins in Cuban Son, Cha-cha-cha, Mambo and other dance forms.

Attire: It is preferred that you wear dance shoes if you have them otherwise you can wear any shoe with a leather or suede sole bottom. If you are taking level 2, dance shoes are mandatory (no sneakers or sandals) and bring a change of shirts with stretch pants.

Length & Pricing: 90 minutes / $25

This class will meet once a week every Friday from 6:30pm-8:00pm for six weeks. If you check our class schedule we may have other SalsaOn2/Mambo classes featured on a different day/time/level so check us out at www.pielcaneladancers.com/ClassSchedule

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-24264659249

This is one of our most popular Meetups... We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.

* THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THIS EVENT IS BEING LISTED ON OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL EVENT ATTENDEES.

"Mingle & Taste 15 Wines From All Around The World!"
Join us for a festive Wine tasting and mingle with fellow upscale NYC professionals where you will get to taste 15 wines in a fun, relaxed environment. There will be red and white wines for all around the world along with delicious cheeses. Detailed instructions on how the wine was made with each pour!. Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring a friend. Expect more than 25 people (mostly singles) to attend. This is not an age specific event. Anyone friendly and interested in mingling and tasting great wine may attend.

Also enjoy complimentary cheeses & crudités!

When: Friday, April 1st: 6:30 - 8:30 PM (You can arrive as early as 6:15 to check-in)
Where: "Some Good Wine" (13 E 8th St, New York, NY - between 5th Ave and University Pl)

POST WINE TASTING MINGLE! After the wine tasting ends we will be inviting all attendees to stroll down the street to a nearby bar so we can continue to mingle. We will be announcing the venue where this will be held during the wine tasting event.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-24264659249

FAQ:

How many people will be attending? We usually have between 25 and 40 people at this event.

What us the dress code? The dress code is "neat, casual or trendy". Basically just don't wear gym attire. What you wear to work is likely perfect.

Can I come alone? Yes 75% attending typically come on their own... some people bring a friend or 2.

Is this event social? Yes! What makes this event great is that a lot of socializing goes on and the vibe is very laid back and friendly.

Do I need to know about wine? Absolutely not... Most come to learn and to socialize.

What is the age range? This is not for a specific age range. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang out and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this event will sell out so grab your ticket as early as possible.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-24264659249

We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.
results.name: Wine Tasting Event - Wines, Cheese & Mingle (PrePay Required)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Join two mediums for a demonstration of mediumship right here in Clark, NJ at Welcome Ohm Wellness Center!

Tickets: https://hopefromheaven.eventbrite.com

Join certified Psychic Mediums Dana Preshous and Sarah Milligan for a two hour Mediumship Demonstration. The mediums will take turns delivering messages from your loved ones in Spirit in honest and heartfelt readings. Lots of love and laughter will be shared in this special event at Welcome Ohm. 

Two dates will be offered:


Hope from Heaven: Friday, April 1, 2016 ~ 7-9pm at Welcome Ohm (Doors open at 6:30pm)

Hope from Heaven: Sunday, April 3, 2016 ~ 1-3pm at Welcome Ohm (Doors open at 12:30pm)

Early Bird tickets will receive Dana’s Meditation CD and $25 off a private reading with Sarah.

Seating is first come, first served, in an intimate setting of 30 people.

While not all audience members will receive a reading, it is still a beautiful experience and you may receive a message indirectly.

Private readings may be scheduled on another date.

Sarah Milligan:www.sarahmilliganwellness.com

Sarah and Dana are both certified Psychic Mediums and Spiritual Advisors who studied, trained and certified with world-renowned Psychic Medium Lisa Williams. They are honored to serve you and your loved ones in delivering messages from the Spirit World to bring healing and love from the Other Side.

Tickets: https://hopefromheaven.eventbrite.com

venue.name: Rubin Museum of Art - K2 Lounge / Cafe Serai

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

results.description:
Sammy Social is a member of several social groups in the city.  One particular day Sammy attended several events, met with friends and toured some historic sites near Herald Square.  By the end of the night Sammy met a horrible fate and the police need your help to solve this case!   Join us for this fun night where you will join with other members of our group to set out on a mission to find clues to solve Sammy's case.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$10 in advance only - prepay here:

http://nysnmurdermyst.eventbrite.com

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

How it works:

-Arrive at St. Pat's for socializing, cocktails and registration.

-If you don't have a team we will put you with other fun people in teams of 4-5.

-Once you are on a team you will receive a sheet retracing Sammy's steps that day.  You will go out into the neighborhood to find clues and fact that will help you solve Sammy's Case.  Along the way you will also learn a little NYC history!

-Each group will have 90 minutes to find as many clues and solve the case.  You will return to St Pat's  for more socializing, cocktails and food if you wish, while we tally up the scores.

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code?  Be comfortable but keep it neat.

What is included?  $10 includes admission to the hunt and drink specials at the bar.

results.description:
INSPIRATIONAL POETRY (Friday events April 1st, 8th, 15th, 22nd, and 29th)

The birds have vanished into the sky,

 and the last clouds have drained away.

 We sit together, the Mountain and me,

 Until only the Mountain remains.    Li Po[masked] (Chinese Poet)

We will read and respond to a variety of Inspirational Poems that can lead us to Oneness, Wonder and Mystery.

Among the poets we will explore are: Mary Oliver, Rumi, Ryokan, Li Po, Rilke, Basho, Hafiz, Chuang Tzu, and many others. 

Please bring your favorite poems (your own or others) and paper and pencil. You can also just come, sit back and just enjoy the beautiful words.

TIME and PLACE: All Souls Unitarian Church 80th Street and Lexington Ave. Follow signs to get to the room. We will start at 7:00 pm sharp, so please come at least by 6:45. Please bring pen and paper to write with.

COST: These events are Free with a suggested donation of $1 to $5 for the Room rental, Equipment and Clean-up. You can come to any session, they are not consecutive. Please RSVP us at [masked] or call Andre and Judy de Zanger at[masked]-8856. Look forward to seeing you!
results.how_to_find_us: Street Floor - "Ware" Room on right
results.name: INSPIRATIONAL POETRY

It's the end of the week.  You've just spent all your energy on working for the man!  Now it is time for you to relax, unwind and treat yourself!  Join us for a really fun after work event where "casual is king"!  We have reserved the 3rd floor private bar at St Pat's Irish Pub for a fun evening or socializing, eating and drinking.  Our staff will be on hand beginning at 6pm to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.  Stop by anytime between 6-9pm for the best socializing. We'll also have some fun games to play to get you to meet others in the group.  Pay as you go for food and drinks.How it works:

-It's pretty simple.  Just show up!!!  Come alone or with a friend or coworker, NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the party.

-If you are hungry we will sit you with other fun people and you can order food on separate checks.

-A few times during the evening we will have fun ice breaker and group games.

-Stay for as long or as little as you would like.

-Music is always played at conversational levels.

Can I come alone:  Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

How many people will be there? Probably 60-80, mostly 20's - 40's

Do I need to eat or drink? There is no minimum on food and drink:

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

results.description:
Admission: Suggested donation: $5, includes snacks and beverages

http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/groundhog.jpg?itok=45NLQV5u Moderator: Chris Everett

Directed by Harold Ramis 

TV weatherman Phil Connors is annoyed and despondent when he's assigned the job of covering the annual Groundhog festivities in the small "Hick" town of Punxsutawney - making this his fourth in a row. The only noticeable upside is his attractive and good-natured producer. But the real nightmare begins when Phil ends up reliving Groundhog Day over and over again. Unable to leave the town and with no end in sight, Phil struggles to find a way to escape his seemingly hopeless situation.

Post-film discussion led by Chris Everett

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

venue.name: Edgar Cayce's A.R.E of New York

results.description:
Can we learn to predict an outcome or have a vision of the future or is one born with the ability? Either can be the case. Edgar Cayce is one of the most famous examples of high-level inborn ability but we all have the capacity to connect to and develop our intuitive skills to varying degrees and learn to interpret psychic information obtained from various sources. The intellect divines based on statistics and models. The intuition can be trained to access information via several modalities. We’ll discuss kinesiology, astrology, reading cards, coffee grinds, palms, chicken guts or bones, dice, and a few other ancient practices, and address the ever-burning question on lottery prediction. We will learn and practice an exercise used by Pranic healers to train sensitivity to energetic outcomes, divining our own questions, then test the results by verifying with partners in groups of three.

NOTE: Following a one hour presentation, the Edgar Cayce Healer’s Group practitioners will offer Bioenergy Healing to all who attend the evening and request it. Occasionally the length of the presentation portion may be adjusted to accommodate a guest speaker, or as karma dictates.
results.name: Divination: The Art of Seeing into the Future with Anton Baraschi

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Meet Up Mary is a regular on the social circuit in New York.   You'd probably know her if you've been out before.  She was very personable, friendly and bubbly!  Unfortunately Mary met a horrific end at Grand Central and the police need you help to solve her case!  Join us for this fun and educational night where you will get to explore every corner of the NYC Landmark in ways that you never have before! (If you have participated in our other Grand Central Hunts no worries as this is a completely different experience)  You will learn, discover, uncover and socialize with other fun members of our group before during and after the hunt!  No experience is necessary!How it works:

-Registration is at St Patrick's Bar on 46th from 6:30-7pm.  We will put you on teams if you don't already have one.

-Each team will be given a list of clues and 90 minutes to head to Grand Central to try and uncover the mystery of Mary's demise!

-The teams with the most points win!

-Once everyone is back we'll have a party where you can share your experiences with the others!

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

Dress code: business casual

How do I pay? Please bring exact change $10

How long does it last?  Everyone will be finished with the Hunt around 9pm.  You can hang for as long or little as you would like at that point
results.name: The Great Murder Mystery at Grand Central Scavenger Hunt and Party

venue.name: The Whitney Museum of American Art

results.description:
We'll be seeing - - - 

LAURA POITRAS: ASTRO NOISE


    Above: Laura Poitras (b. 1964), ANARCHIST: Power Spectrum     Display of Doppler Tracks from a Satellite (Intercepted May       27, 2009), 2016. Archival pigment print on aluminum, 45 1/4     × 65 in. Courtesy the artist. 

    Above: Laura Poitras (b. 1964), ANARCHIST: Data Feed                 with Doppler Tracks from a Satellite (Intercepted May                 27, 2009), 2016. Pigmented inkjet print mounted on                       aluminum, 45 × 64 3/4 in. (114.3 × 164.5 cm). Courtesy the           artist.

Laura Poitras (b. 1964, Boston) is a filmmaker, journalist, and artist. In Astro Noise, her first solo museum exhibition, she expands her cinematic practice into a series of installations and immersive media environments. 

More than a decade ago, in response to the United States invasion of Iraq, Poitras embarked on her powerful "9/11 Trilogy," three feature length documentary films. The first of these, My Country, My Country (2006), follows the family of an Iraqi doctor during the United States occupation. The Oath (2010) weaves together the stories of two men involved with Al Qaeda and the larger issues surrounding the United States prison at Guantánamo Bay in Cuba. Finally, the Oscar-winning Citizenfour (2014) details Poitras’s meetings with whistleblower Edward Snowden as he revealed the massive scale of the National Security Agency’s global surveillance programs. Collectively in these works, Poitras investigates the strategies and tactics developed in the aftermath of 9/11 that have come to be known as the “war on terror”: ground wars in Afghanistan, Iraq, and elsewhere; torture; mass and warrantless surveillance; and the use of drones in what officials call "targeted killing."

She has received many honors for her work, including a MacArthur Fellowship, Guggenheim Fellowship, and a Peabody Award. She has attended the Sundance Institute Documentary Labs as both a Fellow and Creative Advisor. Her reporting on NSA mass surveillance based on Snowden’s disclosures won the George Polk Award for national security journalism, and shared in the 2014 Pulitzer Prize for Public Service. 

She has taught filmmaking at Yale and Duke Universities, and is on the board of the Freedom of the Press Foundation. Along with AJ Schnack and Charlotte Cook, she is co-creator of Field of Vision.

Laura Poitras: Astro Noise is the first solo museum exhibition by the artist/filmmaker/journalist. This immersive installation of new work builds on topics important to Poitras, including mass surveillance, the war on terror, the U.S. drone program, Guantánamo Bay Prison, occupation, and torture. Some of these issues have been investigated in her films, including Citizenfour, which won the 2015 Academy Award for Best Documentary, and in her reporting, which was awarded a 2014 Pulitzer Prize.

For the exhibition, Poitras is creating an interrelated series of installations in the Whitney’s eighth-floor Hurst Family Galleries. The exhibition expands on her project to document post–9/11 America, engaging visitors in formats outside her non-fiction filmmaking. Instead she will create immersive environments that incorporate documentary footage, architectural interventions, primary documents, and narrative structures to invite visitors to interact with the material in strikingly intimate and direct ways.

The title, Astro Noise, refers to the faint background disturbance of thermal radiation left over from the Big Bang and is the name Edward Snowden gave to an encrypted file containing evidence of mass surveillance by the National Security Agency that he shared with Poitras in 2013. The Snowden archive partially inspired Poitras’s presentation at the Whitney.

LAURA POITRAS: ASTRO NOISE 


 Above: Laura Poitras (b. 1964), ANARCHIST: Power Spectrum    Display of Doppler Tracks from a Satellite  (Intercepted May      27, 2009), 2016. Archival pigment print on  aluminum, 45 1/4    × 65 in. Courtesy  the artist. 

 Above: Laura Poitras (b. 1964), ANARCHIST: Data Feed  with      Doppler Tracks from a Satellite (Intercepted May  27, 2009),      2016. Pigmented inkjet print mounted on  aluminum, 45 × 64      3/4 in. (114.3 × 164.5 cm). Courtesy the artist.

Laura Poitras (b. 1964, Boston) is a filmmaker, journalist, and artist. In Astro Noise, her first solo museum exhibition, she expands her cinematic practice into a series of installations and immersive media environments. 

More than a decade ago, in response to the United States invasion of Iraq, Poitras embarked on her powerful "9/11 Trilogy," three feature length documentary films. The first of these, My Country, My Country (2006), follows the family of an Iraqi doctor during the United States occupation. The Oath (2010) weaves together the stories of two men involved with Al Qaeda and the larger issues surrounding the United States prison at Guantánamo Bay in Cuba. Finally, the Oscar-winning Citizenfour (2014) details Poitras’s meetings with whistleblower Edward Snowden as he revealed the massive scale of the National Security Agency’s global surveillance programs. Collectively in these works, Poitras investigates the strategies and tactics developed in the aftermath of 9/11 that have come to be known as the “war on terror”: ground wars in Afghanistan, Iraq, and elsewhere; torture; mass and warrantless surveillance; and the use of drones in what officials call "targeted killing."

She has received many honors for her work, including a MacArthur Fellowship, Guggenheim Fellowship, and a Peabody Award. She has attended the Sundance Institute Documentary Labs as both a Fellow and Creative Advisor. Her reporting on NSA mass surveillance based on Snowden’s disclosures won the George Polk Award for national security journalism, and shared in the 2014 Pulitzer Prize for Public Service. 

She has taught filmmaking at Yale and Duke Universities, and is on the board of the Freedom of the Press Foundation. Along with AJ Schnack and Charlotte Cook, she is co-creator of Field of Vision.

Laura Poitras: Astro Noise is the first solo museum exhibition by the artist/filmmaker/journalist. This immersive installation of new work builds on topics important to Poitras, including mass surveillance, the war on terror, the U.S. drone program, Guantánamo Bay Prison, occupation, and torture. Some of these issues have been investigated in her films, including Citizenfour, which won the 2015 Academy Award for Best Documentary, and in her reporting, which was awarded a 2014 Pulitzer Prize.

For the exhibition, Poitras is creating an interrelated series of installations in the Whitney’s eighth-floor Hurst Family Galleries. The exhibition expands on her project to document post–9/11 America, engaging visitors in formats outside her non-fiction filmmaking. Instead she will create immersive environments that incorporate documentary footage, architectural interventions, primary documents, and narrative structures to invite visitors to interact with the material in strikingly intimate and direct ways.

The title, Astro Noise, refers to the faint background disturbance of thermal radiation left over from the Big Bang and is the name Edward Snowden gave to an encrypted file containing evidence of mass surveillance by the National Security Agency that he shared with Poitras in 2013. The Snowden archive partially inspired Poitras’s presentation at the Whitney.

results.description:
Imagine a group of people, picking up a drum or some percussion; and next thing you know everyone is jamming! The air is filled with infectious sound and movement. You are floating and really feeling the beat! Sound is healing!

Drums and percussion available
$15 at the door

EarthMovers Drum Collective was formed so that everyone could have fun drumming at a circle and share in the rhythm and excitement of the collective drumming experience. Founder and facilitator Dave Miller started drumming with pots and pans, but his love for the art of drumming really grew in 1986 when he held a backyard garden blessing and friends came with drums and percussion. Dave has studied with Babatundi Olatunji, Greg “Sule” Wilson, Marie Tashian, Greg Hochman, Sheik Fall, Fred Goodnight, Jim Dav, Nadine Bergeron, Mark Wood and others. EarthMovers Drum Collective has performed at Kindred Spirits Fair, Saratoga Springs Jazz Festival, Synthetic Pleasure, Harvest Moon Fest, GoddessFest, on the beach, in parks and more.

Dave has enthusiastically performed and grooved at Starwood, Drums Around the World, New Rochelle Arts Festival, Fall Frolic, Drums from Heaven, The Head Start Program, Trenton Makes Words!, Rutgers University and with the PeaceWeavers, Spook Handy, Earth Vision Weavers, Triangle Drum Circle, Joachim Becker, Greg Metz, Sharon Silverstein, Hands of Change, Music For The Goddess, Mark Wood and others.

Dave has produced a variety of music programs and festivals for over 40 years and was a radio host for 7 years. He currently facilitates monthly drum circles and offers Pied Piper Parties drumming for children and adults, both privately and in schools and corporate settings. Contact: Dave Miller[masked] [masked]
[masked]

results.description:
This meetup  on Friday, April 1, from 7pm to 10 pm,  will be dedicated to "Mind Uploading" or possibility of whole brain emulation (WBE) followed by a reception. Neuroscientists have stated that important functions performed by the mind, such as learning, memory, and consciousness, are due to purely physical and electrochemical processes in the brain and are governed by applicable laws. They believe that a consciousness is a product of our neurons network and does not arise from “some magical or otherworldly quality”. We will discuss this topic and if a human brain is just a “way station” or the final destination of the consciousness. Also, will review a current technology approaching to mind uploading.

Before this event, on the same day and the same place, from 4pm to 7pm our scheduled “Contemporary Continental Philosophy” meetup is dedicated mostly to French existentialism (Jean-Paul Sartre) and post-structuralism (Jacques Derrida, Michel Foucault and Gilles Deleuze). So, you are very welcome to attend this early meetup as well.

Our large classroom with a kitchen, wifi etc. are located in SoHo at 594 Broadway, Suite 402, New York, NY 10012. There will be free wine, cheese, and plenty of intellectual pleasure.
results.name: Perspective of Mind Uploading - Host: Prof. Bowen

results.description:
The Flamethrowers meets Let the Great World Spin in this debut novel set amid the heated conflict of Seattle's 1999 WTO protests.


On a rainy, cold day in November, young Victor--a boyish, scrappy world traveler who's run away from home--sets out to sell marijuana to the 50,000 anti-globalization protestors gathered in the streets. It quickly becomes clear that the throng determined to shut the city down--from environmentalists to teamsters to anarchists--are testing the patience of the police, and what started as a peaceful protest is threatening to erupt into violence.

Over the course of one life-altering afternoon, the lives of seven people will change forever: foremost among them police chief Bishop, the estranged father Victor hasn't seen in three years, two protestors struggling to stay true to their non-violent principles as the day descends into chaos, two police officers in the street, and the coolly elegant financial minister from Sri Lanka whose life, as well as his country's fate, hinges on getting through the angry crowd, out of jail, and to his meeting with the president of the United States.

In this raw and breathtaking novel, Yapa marries a deep rage with a deep humanity, and in doing so casts an unflinching eye on the nature and limits of compassion.
results.name: **2nd Book Club Added** Your Heart is a Muscle the Size of a Fist" by Sunil Yapa
