results.description:
The next meetup will be dedicated to "Mind Uploading" or possibility of whole brain emulation (WBE) followed by a reception. Neuroscientists have stated that important functions performed by the mind, such as learning, memory, and consciousness, are due to purely physical and electrochemical processes in the brain and are governed by applicable laws. They believe that a consciousness is a product of our neurons network and does not arise from “some magical or otherworldly quality”. We will discuss this topic and if a human brain is just a “way station” or the final destination of the consciousness. Also, will review a current technology approaching to mind uploading.

Questions/Topics for discussion


Philosophical

- If the individual human mind can be uploaded “as is”, then entire humanity can be (theoretically) uploaded as well? So, the "virtual humanity" should be possible “as is”?

- Is a virtual reality (for upload) should match physical reality or it can be separate Wonderland or both?

- What is next upload from the initial upload? Super virtual reality? Dream inside a dream, inside a dream and so on? What can be Ultimate Upload? How we can describe an evolution of uploads?

- If consciousness is a fundamental feature of the Cosmos then we were downloaded (hierarchically) from some master copy and now are coming (hierarchically) “back home” through the Uploading?

- Is there digital or algorithmic equivalent to consciousness?

Ethical

- Actually, there is no “Uploaded you”, but only real biological you and your unknown digital copy which can function with or without you.

- Digital ethics can be very different. First of all, now you are immortal (conditionally of course) and not depend on any vital needs. No pain, fear, anger and other negative biological emotions. Actually, you would create your own astonishing emotions, friends, pleasure etc. Ultimately, you would be able to duplicate many of “you”, or even create a great team of “you” with multiple presence experience, permanent connection to central super intelligent main frame etc. So, the difference between biological “original you” and uploaded gigantic “super you” can be as huge as difference between you and banana (only about 50% difference in DNA code)

- Is unique individual feelings, happiness, pain, anger etc. are uploadable? Can future technology transfer emotions and higher senses, such as conscience, aesthetics, love, dreams, the experience of art, intellectual satisfaction, etc.?

- Is there should be the filter of what should not be uploaded and stay with humans?

- Is digital evil possible?

Biological

-  Are neurons circuit, patterns etc. are fully detectable for replication?

-  Is brain computable? Is brain just information-processor?

-  Miguel Nicolelis suggested that the brain cannot be reengineered because most of its important features are the result of unpredictable, nonlinear interactions among billions of cells.

- Can we create a neurological formula of mind, consciousness and personality?

-  How a consciousness emerges from non conscious species? What can emerge from the consciousness? Mega-consciousness?

Technological

- Want kind of Brain Computer Interface (BCI) we would need for successful Upload?

- Can computers segregate elements in complex patterns which will makes uniﬁed ''me''? (Binding problem)

- What is a progress in Brain Mapping?

- Creating a synthetic brain by reverse-engineering (Blue Brain Project)

- Neural decoding is about reconstruction of sensory and other stimuli.

- IBM Brain simulation short review

Identity

-  How much of "you" needs to be transferred in order for your digital copy to be sufficiently “you”?

-  Countless copies of “you” can be created. So, how many of you can/should exist simultaneously?

-  After a certain period of time, your copies will develop different experience and different personalities

Destination

-   What is a “home hardware” for Mind Uploading - quantum computers?  Synthetic Reality? Matryoshka Brain?

-   Is biological (or any other) body are required for consciousness?

-  Where the virtual reality will go and who will make a decision?

-  Uploaded "you" would quickly become something quite different and may not like your original self. However, your new super-you may send back to Earth its "avatar" or Human-actor to play with humans and maintain  peace and collaboration with the biological world.

Location

-   Where this Upload will be physically located: Earth, Moon or in space?

-  What kind of external movement/travel can be arranged out of Virtual Reality?

-  Can your digital copy move outside with a speed of light or even faster?


Before this event, on the same day and the same place, from 4pm to 7pm our scheduled “Contemporary Continental Philosophy” meetup is dedicated mostly to French existentialism (Jean-Paul Sartre) and post-structuralism (Jacques Derrida, Michel Foucault and Gilles Deleuze). According to Sartre, Existentialism is the belief that “existence precedes essence.” That is to say that human creation differs from the production of objects, because objects are manufactured with a pre-determined purpose or “essence” in mind, while humans are created and then determine their own meaning through existence (choices and actions). As Sartre puts it, “Man is nothing other than what he makes of himself.

So, you are very welcome to attend this earlier meetup as well.

Our large classroom with a kitchen, wifi etc. are located in SoHo at 594 Broadway, Suite 402, New York, NY 10012. There will be free wine, fruits, cheese, and plenty of intellectual pleasure. Contact me for any questions [masked]

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Rob Magnotti (Comedy Central), Lenny Marcus (Comedy Central), DC Benny, Brian Scott Mcfadden (Tonight Show), Dante Nero! Dustin Chaffin (Showtime!), Shawn Cornelius (BET) and more will be named.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

results.description:
Making a Killing: Guns, Greed, and the NRA  (2016)

Dir. Robert Greenwald

Making a Killing tells the stories of how guns, and the billions of dollars made off of them, affect the lives of everyday Americans. It features personal stories from people across the country who have been affected by gun violence, including survivors and victims' families. The film exposes how the powerful gun companies and the NRA are resisting responsible legislation for the sake of profit - and thereby putting people in danger. The film looks into gun tragedies that include unintentional shootings, domestic violence, suicides, mass shootings and trafficking - and what we can do to put an end to this profit-driven crisis. Through this film and campaign, Brave New Films will work with partners to fight for a country where public safety is more valued than profit.  

Robert Greenwald, the Director, is founder and president of Brave New Films (BNF).  He is an award-winning television, feature film and documentary film maker having produced and/or directed more than 50 TV movies and miniseries.  Greenwald turned to documentary film making in 2000. The documentaries produced by Brave New Films have been streamed across all seven continents and have been viewed over 70 million times and counting.

At BNF, Greenwald has produced and directed eight full-length documentaries and over a dozen short videos, uncovering corporate abuse, the military industrial complex, the unbridled political influence of billionaires, and the unfair and unbalanced tactics of Fox News. His full-length features include; Uncovered: The War on Iraq (2004); Outfoxed: Rupert Murdoch's War on Journalism (2004); Wal-Mart: The High Cost of Low Price (2005); Iraq for Sale: The War Profiteers (2006); Rethink Afghanistan (2009); Koch Brothers Exposed (2012); War on Whistleblowers: Free Press and the National Security State (2013); and Unmanned: America’s Drone Wars (2013). Making a Killing: Guns, Greed and the NRA is BNF’s latest feature-length documentary, set for release in March 2016.
results.name: First Friday Films - Documentaries that Mean Something

results.description:
The Espejo Organization for the Arts and Rabbithole Projects are honored to present Waiting, a photography exhibit by Serbian-Dutch artist Svetlana Jovanovic. On this one-night-only show, Jovanovic will present a series of surreal photographic portraits that question the existing cliches of femininity. Borrowing from the language of fashion photography, Jovanovic’s work provokes an unease and ambiguity, encouraging the viewer to recognize their own objectifying practices and expectations of the female body.


Using isolated and disengaged characters in dreamlike settings, Jovanovic’s solo exhibition, Waiting, features theatrical portraits of women emanating loneliness and alienation. Often using monochromatic and digitally manipulated images, Jovanovic’s explores references of romanticism and surrealism.

Born in Serbia, Svetlana received an MA in Psychology from the University of Belgrade. In 1999, she moved to The Hague, The Netherlands, where she worked with the United Nations. She has also studied at the Royal Academy of Arts (KABK) in The Hague, Nouva Accademia di Belle Arti NABA in Milan, and the International Center of Photography in New York City. In 2015, she moved to NYC, where she is currently living and working on personal and commercial art projects. Svetlana has been published by Vogue Italia, New York Arts Magazine, Beautiful Decay, Musée Magazine, Elements Magazine, Art Reveal Magazine, and many other reputable art publications. She has also exhibited her work in galleries and art spaces in Belgrade, Milan, London, Ljubljana, La Hague, and New York.

This exhibition is curated and organized by The Espejo Organization for the Arts. EOarts is an arts management organization based in Bushwick, Brooklyn, that supports and promotes the work of mid-career and emerging international artists and creatives. Since 2013, EOarts has developed workshops, exhibitions, publications, art residencies, and many other programs with the mission to create an international and multicultural community that will open new possibilities and perspectives for culture worldwide.

The exhibition is presented by Rabbithole Projects. Rabbithole Projects is a contemporary art space located on the waterfront of the Dumbo arts district in Brooklyn. Since 2006, the gallery has exhibited works by emerging and mid-career artists, presenting over 60 group and solo shows as a participant gallery in Dumbo's First Thursday series of art walks. The space operates as a project room, providing artists a forum for showing new works and works-in-progress. Rabbithole Projects also hosts a series of special events, from movie screenings, readings, yoga classes, and the Brooklyn Creative program of artist workshops.

Come join us and have a glass of wine!

First Friday Film Series presents: Much Ado About NothingFriday Apr 1, 2016, 7:30 p.m.<a href="http://piermontlibrary.org/media/gallery/2016-Mar/Much-Ado.png"></a>

Monthly series: 1st Friday of every month. Free and open to public.

April 1st: Joss Whedon's "Much Ado About Nothing" (2012) [PG-13] 1 hr. 49 mins.

Premiering before the show: Much Ado About Dinner, a short film by Chris X. Carroll.

Though not sure of the exact date, scholars are pretty confident that William Shakespeare died just about exactly 400 years ago this month. To commemorate that First Friday Films presents one of our favorite works from Shakespeare, Joss Whedon’s Much Ado About Nothing.

Joss Whedon was deep in post production on the Avengers in 2011 when he found himself with two unexpected weeks off. He and his wife, Kai Cole, had been hosting readings of Shakespeare plays in their living room. Whedon had a birthday coming up, and Cole decided to give him a movie as a present. Making lemons out of lemonade, the two decided to shoot a guerilla production of a full length film in twelve shooting days, on location at their home. Then Whedon would go back to work at the big studio, and finish post and editing on Much Ado on evenings and weekends.

Using hand held cameras, natural light, and what appear to be an awful lot of cocktails the skeleton crew created a gorgeous and real production of Shakespeare’s funniest play. Much Ado About Nothing was shot in digital black and white, on modern cine cameras very similar to what is available to consumers. Whedon cast many of his favorite actors, who’d been attending the readings. Astute viewers will recognize many faces familiar from TV and movies: Nathan Fillion and Sean Maher from Firefly, Rikki Lindhome and Tom Lenk from Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and many others.

This film was made as somewhat of an antidote to the huge corporate behemoth Whedon was creating (the Avengers). Even more germane, it’s made by someone who loves movies. You can see it in every frame. Taking a bunch of actors, one step removed from reading plays on the sofa and throwing them together helps create a funny, vibrant film that crackles with charisma. All from a 400 year old script, to which Whedon neither added nor cut a single word.

results.description:
Our fourth and last movie in the series is Cabin In The Sky from 1943.

Here's all you need to know about Cabin In The Sky: Ethel Waters, Lena Horne, Eddie “Rochester” Anderson, Louis Armstrong, Duke Ellington, Butterfly McQueen, Ruby Dandridge, and others!   If you know who these people are you've probably already decided to see this film, right?

And if you don’t know, well, they were the cream of African-American talent in the 30s and 40s - the funniest, the sexiest, the raunchiest, the most swingin’ black entertainers in America! 

Based on the Broadway musical comedy of the same name (which, by the way, was just revived for four nights only at City Center in February), this is the story of Little Joe Jackson who must choose between his solid wife (Ethel Waters) and a gorgeous seductress (Lena Horne). The General of Heaven battles Lucifer, Jr.for Little Joe’s soul!  It’s a silly plot and corny story to today's eyes, arguably just an excuse for a great cast to sing their songs, strut their stuff and do their things (but see the link at the end for a different take).

Apparently MGM knew they’d make no money on this all-black film but still made it with their highest production values. Just like they would today, right?  This movie is also a rare chance to see the great Ethel Waters at her peak, even if her songs aren’t explicit like her live shows were.

As culture and black consciousness has changed over the past 70 years the film came into criticism for playing to black stereotypes about gambling, religion and simple-mindedness.  Many still find the movie offensive but it remains the only all black, major studio musical, until The Wiz was made in the 1978.  Today we can laugh with this movie, not at it and enjoy it as it was intended.  This is a terrific movie and here's one great dance number https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c58AAcnaPTo

When I was putting together this little description I ran across the following essay about the film from the “Baltimore Black Woman”. I’ve never heard of her and don’t know anything about her but she has a very incisive take on the movie and hers is one of the best criticisms of Cabin In The Sky that I’ve read.  Her point is basically that we should view these characters as archetypes in a Greek morality play and it makes a lot of sense to me to look at it this way  http://baltimoreblackwoman.com/2015/01/11/a-look-back-at-cabin-in-the-sky/

Discussion to follow

$5 suggested donation at the door

Light snacks included

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Rob Magnotti (Comedy Central), Lenny Marcus (Comedy Central), DC Benny, Brian Scott Mcfadden (Tonight Show), Dante Nero! Dustin Chaffin (Showtime!), Shawn Cornelius (BET) and more will be named.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night. Subway party ticket holders also get free access to the After-Party at Studio Square!

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance
Blue: 90’s / 2K / Hip-Hop

Check in Location: Five Mile Stone, 1640 Second Avenue, Manhattan, NY 10028.
Check out: Five Mile Stone.
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: Five Mile Stone, 1640 Second Avenue, Manhattan, NY 10028.

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
100 Limited Tickets
After-Party At Studio Square

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.

Lets celebrate everyones favorite prank day at our founder Rich Sanders place.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

Starring Irish Times award-winning actors Caitriona Ennis and Ian Toner

With music by Susan McKeown, performed live by Mary Murray

Writer of the award-winning These Halcyon Days (IAC 2013), Moment, and Bogboy (IAC 2011), Deirdre Kinahan returns to Irish Arts Center with a new play that explores the energy and complexity of events in Ireland leading up to Easter 1916.

A blighted love story between three young friends from County Meath, Wild Sky charts how the Rising impacted a generation through the small cultural, national, and sporting movements that flourished in Ireland at the turn of the twentieth century.

Wild Sky is a Meath County Council Arts Office commission in commemoration of the 1916 Easter Rising.

See you all at the Highline on Gansvoort Street and Washington street entrance at 7:45 at the base of the steps leading up to the Highline..

Wear comfortable shoes , and bring your umbrellas,, just in case.

Se you all later..

The weather has cleared up.. Yay :)

My cell # is[masked]-1745.. if you need to reach me..

Carly

xxxx

Carly

results.description:
Paul Taylor is one of America's foremost choreographers and is considered the greatest living pioneer of modern dance. For 50 years his dance company has toured the world, with extreme acclaim at every turn. Still at the top of his form, Paul Taylor's dance company continues to mesmerize audiences and garner rave reviews. Mr. Taylor is renowned for the inventiveness, athleticism, social relevance and pure entertainment of his dances.

From Wikipedia, "Paul Taylor is widely considered to be one of the foremost American choreographers of the 20th century. [He] is among the last living members of the second generation of America’s modern dance artists. He has continued to win acclaim for his recent creations as well as stagings of his earlier works. As prolific as ever, he may propel his dancers through space for the sheer beauty of it, or use them to wordlessly illuminate war, spirituality, sexuality, morality and mortality."

From the Paul Taylor Dance Company website: "Choreographer Paul Taylor is the greatest living pioneer of America’s indigenous art of modern dance. At an age when most artists’ best work is behind them, Mr. Taylor continues to win public and critical acclaim for the vibrancy, relevance and power of his creations...Mr. Taylor has made 139 dances since 1954, many of which have attained iconic status. He has covered a breathtaking range of topics, but recurring themes include life and death; the natural world and man’s place within it; love and sexuality in all gender combinations; and iconic moments in American history. His poignant looks at soldiers, those who send them into battle, and those they leave behind prompted the New York Times to hail him as “among the great war poets” – high praise indeed for an artist in a wordless medium. While some of his dances have been termed “dark” and others “light,” the majority of his works are dualistic, mixing elements of both extremes. And while his work has largely been iconoclastic, he has also made some of the most purely romantic, most astonishingly athletic, and downright funniest dances ever put on stage."

Through a special deal directly with the Paul Taylor Dance Company, our Vegetarian & Vegan Meetup Group has the opportunity to see the troop for 50% off at Lincoln Center. We got these tickets months ago, with choice of seats and performances. They are orchestra seats, though near the back, but they are on the first level. We also got a date choice of a Friday night, where the troop is performing two of Paul Taylor's most universally acclaimed works, as well as a new dance by the brilliant young choreographer, Larry Keigwin. I was very fortunate to be working directly with their marketing director months ago to get this incredible deal for our group, while great seats (great enough seats) at a great price were still available. Tickets are only $18.

On Friday, April 1 at 8pm we have the privilege to be attending Paul Taylor Dance Company’s performance at Lincoln Center. The repertoire for that evening includes the following three works works: Polaris, Rush Hour and Esplanade.

-- Polaris, Audience perception is explored in a two-part work in which the dancers move within and around a large metallic cube designed by Alex Katz, to music by Donald York. The choreography of the first section is repeated step for step in the second section but performed by different dancers to different music and lighting. As the score changes from pastoral to menacing and the lighting darkens, the second set of dancers perform the steps with different emphasis and attack than the first, and as a result the viewer’s perception of the exact same choreography is altered. "A barrel of laughs — a delicious lampoon of dance styles of various periods, climes and persuasions. Entertains through superb craftsmanship and genuine wit.” – Walter Terry, New York Herald Tribune.
-- Rush Hour, A brand new dance, premiering here, not choreographed by Paul Taylor but from choreographer Larry Keigwin.
-- Esplanade, "A classic of American dance. It confers a mythic dimension on ordinary aspects of our daily lives – it’s unfaked folk art. The dancers, crashing wave upon wave into those falls, have a happy insane spirit that recalls a unique moment in American life – the time we did the school play or we were ready to drown at a swimming meet. The last time most of us were happy in that way.” – Arlene Croce, The New Yorker.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTES FOR THIS EVENT - MUST READ

***In order to receive a ticket, you must give me cash, in person, in advance of the event.

***RSVPing on this page does NOT guarantee you a spot. You must first RSVP here, and then contact me (by clicking on my photo and then sending me an email through meetup.com), and then meet me to give me $18 per ticket. I will be at Kailash Parbat Indian Restaurant (99 Lexington Avenue, corner of E. 27th Street) on Monday, March 14th from 6pm to 9pm, for our next dinner meetup. You may meet me there, either by RSVPing for our dinner meetup, or you can just stop by inside the restaurant briefly and I can give you the tickets. Most of the tickets have already been purchased. It is best to message me first by clicking on my photo to reserve a ticket with me, and then pick up the ticket at Kailash Parbat on the 14th. (If you miss all this, you can still RSVP on this page, and you may still get a ticket if someone cancels. In that case, please message me to be put on the waitlist.)

***If you are interested in getting a ticket, please first RSVP here. Then you can click on my photo to send me an email. Then find me at Kailash Parbat this Monday, March 14th (our next meetup) to pick up your ticket.

What an amazing opportunity to attend this performance of the Paul Taylor Dance Company at Lincoln Center, and for 50% off! Hope to see you there. (Afterwards, some of us will be going out for a late dinner. Dinner is optional. Venue to be determined.)

Where To Meet: Meeting Directions will be sent to confirmed attendees. We'll be meeting at Lincoln Center at 7:30pm, for the 8:00pm performance.

David

results.description:
The Rebel Alliance has recruited a team of rogues, misfits and ne'er do wells to infiltrate the criminal underworld of Nar Shadaa! Join the notorious Black Crows gang and assist the Rebels in undermining the influence of the Galactic Empire in the underworld of Nar Shadaa, the smuggler's moon.

This is a Star Wars: Age of Rebellion game that takes place on Nar Shadaa in Hutt Space. PCs are agents of the Rebel Alliance who pose as smugglers, bounty hunters and other scum while carrying out the agenda to free the galaxy of the Empire. Force Users are also welcome, as the ancient practices of the Jedi and other Force sects are the highest crimes that the Empire have decreed.

Character types from all three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny) are allowed, and the special FFG dice are provided. New players will be shown how to play this great game, so beginners are welcome.
results.name: Fantasy Flight Star Wars: Age of Rebellion - Rogues of Nar Shadaa

Join us as we check out "Lancer's Restaurant & Night Club". We always have a great time there and the owner is generous and gives us a big section by the dance floor. The food is very good & they have 2 bars. They also have a Live Band & DJ there playing a nice mix of latin dance music and a little top 40.


We'll Be Meeting At 8pm and will have our OWN section right by the dance floor. Just look for our signature red balloons. A 30 minute dance lesson will be provided for this meetup.

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet at La Fama; New York City's all new Salsa Dance Party in the heart of Manhattan's Time Square. 


We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in (which includes a free Salsa Lesson). The Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 3:00am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.

results.description:
Are you ready for the 1st BIKING WITH GUYS EVENT OF THE 2016 SEASON?

Grab your bike and join us for the MOONLIGHT RIDE: a NYC tradition since 1994, The MOONLIGHT RIDE is a casual monthly bike ride on PEDESTRIAN WALKWAYS. UNDER BRIDGES, AROUND PONDS, UP HILLS, and WINDING IN/OUT OF MAIN BIKE LOOP in Central Park! 

We've done this ride 4 times last year, and it is a truly magical and super-fun night!

We'll meet near the giant Globe sculpture in front of Trump Tower at 9:45pm, on the NW corner of 59th St/CPW, then join the larger group that does the ride every month.


As all our other rides, we ask for a $5.00 donation for HOUSING WORKS. (payable in cash or via Venmo: joeyisraelg1@gmail )

**THIS EVENT IS HOSTED BY CENTRAL PARK THE 1ST FRIDAY OF EACH MONTH. IF WE GET RAIN THIS NIGHT, WE'LL RESCHEDULE IT FOR MAY!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in front of Globe, NE corner of Columbus Circle

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


Join us for our Quiet Clubbing Party, indoors at the Studio Square Beer Garden! Drinks, food, and 3 DJs spinning at the same time to keep you singing and partying all night…Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing, you’ll have two other choices to dance and have fun to.

DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: $5 INDOOR Quiet Clubbing At Studio Square!

results.description:
Join the Time's Up environmental grassroots organization for a moonlight ride through Central Park. This is a fun, relaxing auto-free ride suitable for beginners. Enjoy the tranquillity of the park & its beautiful ponds & waterways: a nature lover's dream. Totally safe. Bike guides front & rear. The Time's Up group will meet at Columbus Circle (SW corner of Central Park). Weather is expected to be clear and temperature in the mid-50s.

Meeting Place: Columbus Circle entrance to Central Park at 59th Street & Columbus Circle.

Date: 04/01/2016, Friday
Time: 10:00 pm
Pace: beginner

The ride moves at a very leisurely pace with a few stops to enjoy the scenery. We usually finish before midnight, back at Columbus Circle. Total mileage is under 10 miles. We do not require lights (although if you have them you should bring them), and any kind of bike will work.

For more information: http://times-up.org/rides/moonlight-ride-central-park
results.name: Moonlight Ride Through Central Park

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"

results.description:
PLEASE BRING BOTH A BLUE T-SHIRT & A WHITE T-SHIRT.                                                                                                                                                                                 Downtown PickUp Soccer

Started by a group of soccer fanatics who love to play the Beautiful Game and wanted to create a meetup for individuals of all levels. 

Our Mission: Play safe, get your workout on & HAVE FUN!!

The Lowdown: 

1. Play safe,  excessive aggression will NOT be tolerated (the precinct is across the street...LOL!!). 

2. Cleats are permitted, and Sneakers or Turf Shoes are acceptable as well. We play for an hour with a break in the middle. If no volunteered goal keeper, players will rotate the position. We play with corner kicks and throw-ins. Also, everyone should bring a Blue T-Shirt and a White T-Shirt

3. Pitch Location: Between Baxter & Mulberry St.with additional entrance on Worth & Bayard St. 

4. Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street. 

5. HAVE FUN!

See you Downtown! 

Terms and Conditions of the participating in our group:

PLEASE READ THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE CAREFULLY. 
BY USING THIS WEBSITE, YOU AGREE TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS. 

JOINING AND SIGNING UP FOR DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 

I certify that I am 18 years of age or older and that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore I, individually, hereby release and discharge, DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizers and Co-organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER programs or activities. 

DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizer and its Co-Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

The Downtown Pickup Soccer Team
results.how_to_find_us: Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street.
results.name: Morning Soccer @ Columbus Park - 7:45AM

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Qi Gong is a part of traditional Chinese medicine that views and treats the body, mind and the environment as a whole. Qi Gong practices include slow body movements, meditation, and special breathing techniques. Qi Gong students can experience deep relaxation, concentration and a peaceful, clear mind. In addition, Qi Gong practices help to clear energy blockages and improve blood circulation in the body. In this class, students will learn Qi Gong exercises to increase flexibility, improve balance, reduce stress, increase concentration, and rejuvenate the mind, body, spirit and more!

The cost for attending eight Saturday classes is $65 for Non-Greenburgh residents, and $54 for Greenburgh residents.

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it).
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.) Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances. We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Started by a group of soccer fanatics who love to play the Beautiful Game and wanted to create a meetup for individuals of all levels. 

Our Mission: Play safe, get your workout on & HAVE FUN!!

The Lowdown: 

1. Play safe,  excessive aggression will NOT be tolerated (the precinct is across the street...LOL!!). 

2. Cleats are permitted, and Sneakers or Turf Shoes are acceptable as well. We play for an hour with a break in the middle. If no volunteered goal keeper, players will rotate the position. We play with corner kicks and throw-ins. Also, everyone should bring a Blue T-Shirt AND a White T-Shirt.

3. Pitch Location: Between Baxter & Mulberry St.with additional entrance on Worth & Bayard St. 

4. Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street.

See you Downtown!

results.description:
There are more millionaires in the United States than ever before...9.63 million households with a net worth of $1 million or more. According to income tax and net wealth data, the largest percentage attain their wealth by running businesses. Studies of wealthy people show that there are 4 skills that they have mastered to make them successful. You can learn, practice and refine these skills this Saturday with  Dynasty Investment team.

1. Finding People

Millionaires are great at finding people to partner with, recruit, or develop a relationship with. In order to have any successful business you need to perfect 2-7 ways of finding people. Dynasty Investments team teaches over 100 ways to find people for your business. This Saturday come learn from Jessica Zaretsky as she walks you through several of our top money-making ways build your business with people. 

2. Telling the Right Story...the Right Way

Millionaires know how to talk the talk before they walk the walk. They know how to talk about themselves, their product, and their goals. They also know that part of talking the right way is to know when to shut up! Come learn from Tamara Book who made $11,340 in a week in March. See what skills she has mastered to have $10,000 weeks!

3. Build for Event after Event


A dog with a bone...a cat with its string...a mouse with its cheese. What do all these animals have? Passion. Passion is what keeps a millionaire engaged in their business and what rubs off on those around them. Millionaires develop customers by learning how to keep them coming back for more. This Saturday, Ram Mishra & Hugh Zaretsky will teach you how to keep your customers coming back for more and more and more with Social Media. You will learn how to turn your passion into a system that makes you money by following simple steps to move people from small events to larger and larger ones in your business.

4. Follow Up

Millionaires do not take "no" for an answer. They believe that everyone needs their product and so they learn to follow up and follow up until a customer says "yes." In your business you have to understand how to effectively follow up with new prospects, old prospects and in-between prospects because fortune is in the follow up. Learn how to organize your follow ups for your business from Hugh Zaretsky, top income earner each year since we launched this business..

BONUS TRAINING - We will have an hour bonus training for all IMAs and Team members to go over your own personal ads, phone calls, squeeze pages, etc... Hugh & Jessica and our Top Income Earners will help all team members put themselves into a position to cashing a $10,000 checks. Will you be the next person to join our $15,000 Income Wall?

results.description:
Information


Come enjoy a nice hike along the Long Path (section 13) on a stroll along Wurtsboro Ridge and through South Gully. Full details of the Long Path can be seen by clicking HERE 


Parking Locations

We will meet at the Sam's Point Preserve visitor center ($7 parking fee charged). [masked]°, [masked]°)

We will then shuttle to the start on Ferguson Road  (0.7 miles west of Shawanga Lodge Road). There is limited roadside parking near the trail crossing (about 5 cars' worth, which is plenty) [masked]°, [masked]°)

Trail Maps


<a href="http://nynjtc.org/files/ShawangunkRidgeTrail-Map2_2013.pdf"></a>

NYNJTC Trail Map 104 (Shawangunk Trails)

Description


This will be a moderately-paced hike, aimed at about 2.5 mph overall, with time to stop for photos along the way. Be sure to bring plenty of water, and either lunch or snacks as needed. Well-behaved trail dogs welcome, as I will likely be bringing my super-friendly German shepherd.

*** While I'm no speed-burner, because this is a traverse with a shuttle, please know your hiking speed. Hiking at 2.5 is an overall average, which means more like 3 mph on flat ground.

The Long Path is co-aligned with the Shawangunk Ridge Trail, and is primarily ridgetop with many spectacular views in all directions. These are among the most dramatic in southern New York. The low forest frequently places the hiker above the trees with unlimited visibility. The trail traverses the ridge to old Route 52, now a woods road, and follows this for a couple of miles until it reaches NY Route 52 and South Gully. The trail then enters Minnewaska State Park, and ascends through South Gully to Sam's Point Preserve.


HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER

Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
This is a moderately paced adventure under, over, around and through many of the amazing architectural wonders throughout Central Park. We begin our walk at the southwest tip of Central Park South and zigzag our way up the eastern half of Central Park to The Harlem Meer at 110th St. Then we circle back along the western half of the park and finish at Sheep's Meadow. Please bring water and lunch or snack for this fascinating 5-hour journey of approx. 8 miles. 

MEET: 9 AM sharp at the Atrium entrance to the Time Warner Towers Complex at 59th St. & Columbus Circle. Take the A, C, D or 1 train to 59th St. Rain or Shine! 

Leader: Matthew Brozyna [masked]


Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

New captains, RSVP for more information. 

New captains meet 9:00am at the entrance to Central Park at the southwest corner of Fifth Ave. and 79th St 

From there we walk to our trailer in the Ramble lot just off the East Drive in the Park at 79th St. You can lock your bikes and personal stuff in the trailer.  After orientation and bike safety checks, we ride as a group up to 90th St. where our stokers (our members who ride on the the back) will be waiting. 

Experienced captains can meet at the trailer at 9:30am.


Stokers and non-riding volunteers meet at 10:00am at 90th St. and Fifth Ave, just inside the Park at the benches on the north side of the entrance - adjacent to the two water fountains. 

Helmets will be provided if needed. please dress warmly. 

Please RSVP if you plan to attend and specify if you are a captain or non-riding volunteer.

results.description: Not Suitable for beginners, slow hikers, runners, and dogs are not allowed, but anyone else who wants to do a hard but fun hike is welcome.and Let’s celebrate Spring by doing a fun hilly demanding 10 mile hike up Bear, West, Timp, and Bald Mountains. We will meet at the Manitou train station at 9:00, and then shuttle over to the parking lot on 9W near the Cornell trail. We will start the hike by hiking up the Cornel trail to the 77 trail, and then take the Major Welch trail up Bear Mountain, and then take the AT down Bear Mountain, and up West. On West Mountain we will then take the TT down West, and up the Timp. We will then take the Rd down the Timp, and up the backside of Bald Mountain. We will then take the C trail back to the cars. The hike will be about 10 miles with four good steep climbs, and will be a fun friendly, but demanding hike with a reasonable number of stops. Leader determines the pace, route, number of stops and duration of stops. If you want to run do not come. If you want to stroll chose another hike. This hike is not easy, and involves 3100 feet of elevation gain. No dogs allowed. Bring at least 3 quarts of water your lunch and wear hiking boots. Rain Cancels. Trans. 5B, but take the Early Metro North Train that leaves 7:48 and arrives at Manitou at 8:58. Drivers park at the end of Manitou road which is located 1 ¼ miles of Bear Mountain Bridge on Manitou Road off 9D. L: Joe Nigro[masked] (7:30-9:30 PM) [masked].
results.name: 10 Mile Bear, West Timp, and Bald MT hike.

results.description:
So we just got notice that our workshop proposal was accepted by NEQTPOC which means...WE IN DA BUILDIN!!! YAAAASSSSSSSS!!!!

Our workshop is titled "A Non-comprehensive Guide on Building community rooted in Womanism & Black Feminism" and we would love for you to be involved in planning with us. Email us if you're interested: <a>[masked]</a>

Otherwise, we still welcome your attendance. Like WWC, the NEQTPOC conference values accessibility and has priced registrations at $25 per person. Another win!

You will be responsible for your own registration fee ($25) & travel ($10 roundtrip via Megabus; current prices may increase closer to departure date so book quick).

Updates: Choose the 6:30am-8:40am (departure) & 9:20pm - 11:20pm(returning) if you want to ride together. If you have your own transportation great, just meet us there! :-) 

If you plan to stay overnight for the Black Writers conference event and need suggestions on booking lodging separately or with other members, email us directly or reach out to the RSVP list directly.

For now, just make sure you take care of your registration as soon as you can to secure your spot. We'll update you as progress is made: REGISTER HERE

About the conference:The Northeast Queer & Trans People of Color (NEQTPOC) Conference strives to provide unity, empowerment, visibility, and validation for all queer- and trans- identifying people of color in the northeast region of the United States.The conference strives to foster a space where QTPOC can network and dialogue about the complexities of their intersections beyond the LGBTQ+ spectrum.It will be a time to re-appropriate the queer- and trans- histories that have been politically erased.
results.name: NEQTPOC Conference 2016

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Saturday Morning Run

results.description:
Sat. Ap 2.  Reeves Brook Circular  2 E  7

Elevation gain about 1200’.  Pace, slow.  Terrain: roughed Harriman hills:  2 climbs.  Rocky  trails.  Open woods walking on  grass,  rock slabs, leaves,  with patches of underbrush: no short pants.  About 7 miles.  No early out.  Beginning at Reeves Brook Visitor’s Center join the crowds , on the long relatively smooth but rooty climb to the beautiful Pine Meadow lake including the rocky approach to the  Cascade of Slid.  Circling the lake counter clockwise, locate Thorne Valley Road and follow SW hoping for views of  the Ramapo Thorne and Russian Bear from below.  We turn north at a stream descending from the base of the Bear, to climb the steep slope, maybe discovering a cascade or two,  ultimately connecting to the HTS, : climb some more, till time the detour to the baby bear.  Pat the fellow. Lastly, top off on Thorne View of the Thorne basin.  Zipping back at my slow pace to the cars via the 7 hills and the decent of the always impressive Reeve Brook trail over a jagged sawblade like landscape.  Bring two qtrs.  of liquid.  Deet insect repellant:  The ticks are hungry.  Sun blocks, my neck and  arms are pink from Sat.’s hike.  Check NOAA and dress in layers to minimize sweating.  Transportation 1 B,  Sloatsburg with shuttle to Reeves Brook.  Leader Bill Hladky  914. [masked]  [masked]

1 Applies to weekends only: 8:30 a.m. SHORT LINE bus run #401 [masked] www.coachusa.com/shortline) North Wing – Note: run #401 discharges passengers upon request during boarding along the Rt. 17 corridor. Coachusa website does not include request stops shown below. (Late bus run # 389 leaves NYC at 9:10). Map of all Trans Code 1

A. Not Used

B. Sloatsburg, Rockland CO., NY. Arr. 9:15. Meet at Municipal Building Parking Lot located north of 2nd stop light. Follow signs into parking lot. Map and directions
explannation of transportation codes. 

http://www.amc-ny.org/transportation-codes/#.VRqiElaJmhM

Come and experience unique and authentic Yang style Tai Chi taught by Master Yao Wah Chan. Master Yao was a student of Pang-Na Chang, a third generation Yang style master. Tai Chi moves energy through all the meridians of the body, massaging the internal organs, resulting in clearing and increasing the body's energy. We will do the Yang Style 24 and 88 form in the class, and we divide the class into beginners and more experienced practitioners. The class will conclude with group practice of the form. 

The cost for attending eight Saturday classes is $65 for Non-Greenburgh residents, and $54 for Greenburgh residents.

results.description:
FLUENCY PROJECT – FORCED FLUENCY™ ONE-DAY IMMERSION PROGRAM (10 Different Languages!)

One full day (12 HOURS!) of language awesomeness for just $125!  

Now 10 languages to choose from, including English! Pick ONE: Chinese (Mandarin), English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish. I chose these languages based on the survey feedback I received, so thanks to those who participated! 

AGENDA (subject to change slightly based on feedback from prior students)

9:45    Arrival
10:00 – 11:00      Intro, Paperwork, Word Lists, Conjugation, Etc. with **5 minute stretch break**
11:00 – 1:00    Intensive Reading (bring your own or select from something I bring) with **5 minute stretch break at noon**
1:00 - 1:30    Lunch
1:30 - 3:30  Intensive Writing of an Essay with **5 minute stretch break at 2:30**
3:30 - 5:15  Intensive Listening of Radio with **5 minute stretch break at 4:15**
5:15 - 5:30  Dinner Break
5:30 - 7:30  Native Speaker Listening, Speaking, Essay Correction with **5 minute stretch break at 6:30pm**
7:30 – 8:00  Public Speaking Presentation of Essays
8:00 -- 8:30  Wrapup, Congrats
8:30 – 9:00    Study Hall (Review vocab; Study plans; rewrite essays; Feedback forms)
9pm - 10pm  Free time if needed. 

SPEAKING/LISTENING REQUIREMENTS: 
* You must already speak/understand at a LOW INTERMEDIATE or higher level. (Low Intermediate = can have general conversations with native speakers without too much difficulty) 
* Why so high? Because if you can’t converse, your partner(s) are going to be upset with you, hee hee. :) 


READING/WRITING REQUIREMENTS:
* You must already read/write at a BEGINNER or higher level.
(Beginner = can survive in the country if you could not speak any other language)
* Why so low? Because this is mostly an individual activity, so your level will not impact others too much.  It's up to you how you feel about reading advanced texts.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
* You need a smartphone or tablet with wifi capability.
* You need to bring earphones.
* You need one or two books/magazines you are reading, plus any grammar or vocabulary references you like to use.
* You need to agree to speak your target language 98% of the time.  You CANNOT be lazy.
* You need to bring a notebook.
* You need to bring pencils with a good eraser OR erasable pens.  You will NOT be allowed to write your essay with normal pens OR on a computer.
* You need to agree to stay for the entire event.
* You need to agree to faithfully participate in all events to the best of your ability.

Cost: $125.

Why: You get TWELVE HOURS of forced fluency practice, including a live native speaker (for one hour) who will also correct your writing exercises; plus intensive writing practice, intensive speaking practice, intensive listening practice, and intensive reading practice—ALL WITHIN VERY SMALL GROUPS OF 2 – 3 PEOPLE THAT REALLY ALLOWS YOU TO WORK. You will learn more in this one day than you could in an entire five-week language course AND it is far less expensive! You will leave this advanced intensive with better reading skills, writing skills, listening skills, and speaking skills—GUARANTEED—or your money back* (*See refund policy below). So THAT’S what you’re paying for. As a bonus, you will also meet others who are just as serious about language learning as you are, and hey, that’s always a good thing. Designed by a world-traveling language junkie PhD Psychology student (3 months from graduation) who truly understands what it takes to become fluent. This will be a day filled with joyfully fun and abundantly serious language mastery lessons that will stay with you for the rest of your life.

For Who: For someone (like you?) who is unequivocally serious about finally devoting the time and effort towards becoming fluent in your chosen foreign language. This one-day intensive is as intense (and probably more so) than an advanced foreign language course at university. This course will force you to do the sometimes boring and always difficult exercises and activities that you NEED to do in order to master a foreign language. During these very intensive 12 hours, you will be FORCED to read, write, speak, and listen, in a fun (but organized and firm) environment that leads to guaranteed results. You will also be treated to a 30-minute speech by a native speaker, speaking at normal speed. A native speaker (or language expert) will also be there to correct your written essay, so you will leave knowing where you made your mistakes.  NOTE: if you enjoy spending 12 hours by yourself at home reading, writing, listening, and finding a native speaker on your own, great!  Then this program is not for you.  This program makes 12 hours of intense language study fun, sociable, motivational, and efficient--because it's all prepared in advance for you.  Seriously, how many of you have recently spent 12 hours ON YOUR OWN studying non-stop from 10am - 10pm?  The truth: it just doesn't happen.  So yeah, you can do much of these things on your own, and you can set up your own events if you want.  But if you enjoy having ME do it for you, and make it easy for you to focus with the added discipline of having other language learners in the room with you, then this is for you. :)

WARNING: this course is not for lazy people and NOT for beginners. It WILL be exhausting; it WILL be tiring; and that's good because directly as a result, it WILL end up being (quite probably) the most practical and useful foreign language course you have ever experienced. All in just one day.  Pretty awesome if I say so myself, and yup, I'll be participating too!  

REFUND POLICY:
* You will NOT be given a refund if you simply cancel after paying--others are counting on your being there, so you need to commit. This policy is my way to help ensure that it is more likely you will attend. If there is a serious medical or family emergency, please provide a note from your doctor or other official verifying this fact. Otherwise, I suggest you just attend (haha) or transfer your registration to a friend who speaks the same language (with our permission). Please try to respect your fellow students (and me!) who are counting on you being there.
* If you pay, but on the day of the immersion, simply do not show up, you will NOT be given a refund because others were counting on you to be their language partners.
* If you pay, attend the event, and participate in all exercises and then truly feel the course did not improve your language skills in any measurable way, you will be given a full refund. However, before paying, you agree to read the course description above in full, and fully acknowledge that this is not a traditional language class—much of the work will be forced solitary or group practice. Do NOT attend this course if you expect to be spoon fed everything. One of the main purposes of this program is to force intermediate and advanced students to do the things they typically do not do by themselves on a regular basis. “All we did is read and write and talk to one another and listen to audio” is not a valid reason for “not meeting your expectations”—um, that is precisely the purpose of this course and precisely what will help develop your fluency! That being said, please go into this knowing what to expect.

I look very much forward to seeing many of you at the event!

-Monroe Mann, Esq. 
Founder, Fluency Project 


P.S. - In answer to your question, "Why are you charging for a meetup?", my response is, "My dear, why should you get this for free?" :D  Most meetups are a colossal waste of time, and are ineptly organized.  This event will be impeccably organized, and expertly driven, and that should already be clear.  I've spent tens and tens of hours putting this together, and will spend even more time and money creating the materials.  The space costs money.  The native speakers cost money.   Meetup takes 10% for the credit card fees.  My time too is valuable (don't you agree?).  My event WILL help you gain fluency, and $125 is extremely generous given all that you will receive.  I know I could charge twice if not thrice this amount and still feel good about myself. :D  But my hope is to keep the fee as low as possible while also paying expenses.  Hope this answers your question!
results.name: FORCED FLUENCY™ ONE-DAY IMMERSION PROGRAM (TEN DIFFERENT LANGUAGES!)

Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday -@west 134th Street Field - 9:45am
