ARE YOU READY TO MIX & MINGLE!!

TREAT YOURSELF AND FRIENDS TO AN EXCITING EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING, AND DANCING AT THE  NORTH STREET TAVERN.

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN THIS WARM AND COMFORTABLE SETTING

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP AND A HEAD COUNT FROM ALL THE OTHERS!

DJ WILL BE PLAYING ALL OF YOUR FAVORITE HITS TO GET YOU ON THE DANCE FLOOR STARTING AT 10 PM.

BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF PARKING AVAILABLE IN IN FRONT OF THE RESTAURANT AND PLEASE USE THE SIDE ENTRANCE BY THE BAR.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!
results.how_to_find_us: PLEASE R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE AND TRY TO HAVE EXACT CHANGE AT THE DOOR, THANK YOU!

results.description:
Come Join Us For A Spring Fling Party @ Ruby Lounge!

Doors Open At 8pm

$5 Cover Til 10pm. $10 Entry Afterwards.

• Giant Dance Floor.

• Free Parking In Their Huge Lot.

• DJ Mix Of Classics, Top 40 And More.

• Cover Includes 1 Free Ticket For Our Prizes Raffle.

• We'll Arrange A Section For Meetup Members To Mingle At.

Multiple Meetup Groups And Many Non Meetup Singles Will Be In Attendance. Expect A Big Crowd.

Come Out To Drink, Dance, Mingle And Have Some Spring Fun @ Ruby Lounge!

Ruby Lounge And Parking Is Behind The Holiday Inn Pictured Below.

Off Rt 46 West Make A Right @ The Petco Sign. Go Around The Buildings To The Right And Park In The Big Lot To The Left Of The Hotel Parking Lot.

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com
[masked]
(201)[masked] Cell
results.name: Saturday Tennis Social at Binghamton Racquet Club

results.description:
$15.PP Saturday Argentine dance party. with Live music OR  DJ's      Please send en email to confirm your full name as member of the Meetup and the numbers of people for the party if you will like to stay and we will reserve a table for you.    There will be a special envelop with your name as team leader.

Saturday Night romance here is the program of the night!

Intro to Argentine Tango class 8:30-9:30pm

Dance party all night 9:30pm to 3am

Special performance at 11:50pm

            Plus

Free one Tango group class every Wednesday at 8:30-9:30p

MEETUP members receive big discountedall for $15. - (Reg. $45)

Milonga De Barrio Every 1st Saturday of each month

Join us at every 1st Saturday where you'll be transported to 1920's Buenos Aires.

Step into your neighborhood tango saloon - the warmth of a sexy, subtle light draws you into the romantic atmosphere of rich crimson decor.  The enticing sounds of tango music playing on a gramophone... draws you into the intimate embrace of figures moving slowly... the lingering glances... the infinite possibilities.

8:30pm Absolute beginners tango &  INT Tango lesson

&

11:45:00pm Performance - Raffle Drawing and Hot Salsa Music Break

Intro to Argentine Tango Group Lesson and the Dance  * MEETUP members receive discounted admission of Milonga & Class $15.


Come learn the basic steps of the Argentine tango, listen to the best selection of tango music from the Golden Age and dance the night away. The environment is always relaxed and friendly. Special guest DJs and performances  * You don't need a partner. Feel free to invite friends to join you!

Intro to Tango Class 8:30 - 9pm

Milonga 9pm - 3am


* Performance or  LIVE TANGO MUSIC every 1st Saturday of the month

* Complimentary Refreshments (BYOB welcomed)

MEETUP MEMBERS: ONLY $15

(Just RSVP and mention "Meetup" at the door.)

THE BALL NY
131 W35th Street, 5th Fl.

(Btwn Broadway & 7th Ave)

New York, NY  10001
results.name: TANGO A ROMANTIC DANCE PARTY EVERY 1ST SATURDAY  Milonga Del Barrio

results.description:
IMPORTANT: HOW THE TICKETS WORK
If you have the original set regular tickets. Then the name you used on Paypal or Square Up will be the name at Will Call. The PIT Theater's will call is IMMEDIATELY to the left of the main doors.


If you have OVERFLOW tickets, then *I* will have your tickets, and I will know the name you gave via PayPal or Square Up. I am the bearded guy who will be wearing Ravenclaw robes. The pre-show waiting area (which is also a bar!) is not very large, so finding me will not be difficult. I will alternate my time from the front of the line to the main theater doors and the will call box office. This distance I will be migrating back and forth from is about 20 feet.
DOORS: The main doors will open to begin seating into the theater at around 9:30pm. SEATING IS GENERAL ADMISSION EXCEPT FOR OVERFLOW. So the regular ticket holders will be let in first, and once they are seated, the overflow seating will be allowed in. For general seating, since where you sit is pretty much first come first serve, it can't hurt to get in at 9pm or earlier to line up before door open.


Those who have discussed special seating needs with me. The box office knows about those needs and the door manager will know, and I will be there in case there are any issues. If your needs require you to be seated earlier, please find me so I know you have arrived and we will make the approriate arrangements.


AT THE END OF THE SHOW: I have arranged for a fun group photo with the cast. DO NOT LEAVE YOUR SEATS after the bows. The cast will be coming into the audience to get a huge group photo with us. After that, members of the cast will be come out to the bar to say hello, get photos, sign show programs, etc. Its pretty casual =)
I hope that covers everything, if you have any questions please let me know via direct message.


-------

We have arranged to have exclusive showing of the hysterical comedy PUFFS performed just for The Group That Shall Not Be Named.

Puffs is a comedy about the Hogwarts Hufflepuff house and what happened to them during Harry Potter's years at Hogwarts. It is funny, touching, and brilliant. If you are a Harry Potter fan you cannot miss this show!

Tickets are $20 + $1 paypal processing fee. Coming in costume is definitely encourage but never required!

IMPORTANT!!!!!!

It is essential that you RSVP and pay for this event as soon as you can. We have to make a deposit on the show in the next few days. So I need to know that we are not taking a large risk.  We have to pay for much of the seats in advance. So if we are not able to sell them, then we will be losing  A LOT of money that the Meetup cannot afford to lose. So heck, feel free to buy tickets for your friends as well!!



If we do not get at least 20 RSVP's by Thursday / Friday morning at the latest, then I will need to consider cancelling this event.

If you need to pay in cash, please email me at [masked] so we can make arrangements.

Also note that because of these payment requirements, we cannot provide refunds only ticket transfers.
results.name: Exclusive Performance of PUFFS the Play!

group.name: Harry Potter NYC - The Group that Shall Not be Named

results.description:
You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results!

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating is limited and by reservation only.  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. 

Eventbrite Link: http://bit.ly/1MwuDs9

Seating in the backroom starts at 930 and the show starts shortly after. 
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager! - FREE COMEDY SHOW

Have a Birthday Coming up! Contact us to do your Bday Party.

results.description:
We’re back at it in Brooklyn, with the next phase of our new series at the incredible Kimoto Rooftop, where we’ll be holding it down the way we always do, with three live DJ’s spinning the wildest tracks, as we take in the incredible scenery, from up above. If you hit our initial launch party here 2 months ago, you already know how fun this place gets, so it’s not one to be missed! Plus, there will be some solid drink specials to keep things interesting.

Your 3 DJs will be spinning:
DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop, etc
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention
Drink Specials until 11:30 pm:
$6 beer & shot
$7 wines
$8 cocktails

Special Notes:
Dress Code – Smart Casual
-No sportswear, baseball caps or baggy clothing
-Collared shirts and fitted fashionable attire recommended
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

results.description:
Join us this Saturday night for some Shakespearean madness. Here's our most recent review from the NY Times! http://www.nytimes.com/2016/03/29/theater/if-you-want-to-make-a-hamlet-you-have-to-break-some-rules.html?_r=1

In 400 years of Shakespeare, there’s never been a night of Bard on the boards quite like "Gary Busey’s One-Man Hamlet as Performed by David Carl." The 2015 Edinburgh Fringe hit hailed by critics as “pant-soilingly hysterical” (British Theatre Guide) comes to NYC’s PIT Loft for a two-month run, March 26-May 14, before heading to the Chicago Shakespeare Theater as part of their year-long Shakespeare 400 celebration.

As Shakespearean actor, puppeteer, singer and action-movie director, Gary Busey (played by New York actor-writer David Carl) performs each scene of Hamlet his way, with occasional detours into great Busey moments from "Buddy Holly" and "Lethal Weapon." The heady mix of high and low-brow comedy celebrates Shakespeare’s classic by using it to reflect upon the jaded, celebrity-crazed, meme-obsessed world around us.

★★★★ “Crazy hilarious.” - TimeOut New York
“So demented a concept, it actually works” – NY Post
★★★★★ “70 batshit crazy hilarious minutes” - Broadway Baby

The smash hit of the New York and Edinburgh Fringe Festivals, "Gary Busey’s One-Man Hamlet..." won the Outstanding Solo Performance Award at the New York Fringe in 2014, and received 5-star reviews at the 2015 Edinburgh Festival Fringe. The show will begin extensive North America touring in 2016, including performances at the Chicago Shakespeare Theater - proving that "Where there's a Bard, there's a Busey!"

Written by David Carl (after Shakespeare) and co-created and directed by Michole Biancosino.

Tix at www.buseyhamlet.com

This meetup is rescheduled to Sunday due to bad weather.

Burn over 500 Calories per Session! PLEASE READ BEFORE RVSP!


This will be a combination of high endurance running and muscle building bootcamping aimed at improving core. This is not an easy activity and I don't expect any amateurs. To participate, you should be in a good physical condition and able to run 5-6 miles without stops.


The loop will consist of asphalt and gravy roads. We will be stopping at exercise stations and perform a set of routines. The whole routine should only take you 40 minutes or so.


Come prepared with running shoes and layers of clothes in case the weather is cold. It is better to be safe than sorry!

I expect you to follow at the pace of the group. If you are fast or slow, you should be sticking with the group. No one should be ahead of us, neither no one should be lost. Come prepared. It is not a walk in a park. It is a heavy endurance exercise!

Rain or any adverse weather cancels.

More meetups will follow soon. This is a new, but very active group!

------------------------------------------------------

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Book to discuss: Guns, Germs and Steel: The Fate of Human Societies  by Jared M. Diamond

Below is from Amazon.com:

"Fascinating.... Lays a foundation for understanding human history."―Bill Gates

In this "artful, informative, and delightful" (William H. McNeill, New York Review of Books) book, Jared Diamond convincingly argues that geographical and environmental factors shaped the modern world. Societies that had had a head start in food production advanced beyond the hunter-gatherer stage, and then developed religion --as well as nasty germs and potent weapons of war --and adventured on sea and land to conquer and decimate preliterate cultures. A major advance in our understanding of human societies, Guns, Germs, and Steel chronicles the way that the modern world came to be and stunningly dismantles racially based theories of human history. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize, the Phi Beta Kappa Award in Science, the Rhone-Poulenc Prize, and the Commonwealth club of California's Gold Medal.“

Available in New York Public Library (including E-book and audible).

results.description:
Try It You'll Like It and if you do, sign up and start your lessons the same day. We'll credit your try SCUBA payment towards the class and give.

For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

Cost: $25.00 Click to Pay Now!  (Get a $25 credit for your Lessons)

If at the end of the session you are ready to start. You can sign up on the spot and hop right back in.

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

•  Student Information Form

• SDI General Waiver for all Courses

• SDI Medical Info Waiver

*Physician Sign-Off Form This form MUST BE COMPLETED if the answer to ANY question on the "Medical Info Waiver form is YES before participating

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details:
9:00am, Starbucks in Sunnyside. There will be TWO pace groups! One at an 8:30/9:00 minute-per-mile, and one at 10:00/10:30 minutes-per-mile.

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: It's winter, so the water fountains are turned off in all City Parks. Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

We invite “seekers” new to exploring faithful living, dedicated followers of Christ, people filled with a new enthusiasm and a desire to serve and grow, people who’ve “fallen away” from “organized religion” but are giving it a second look, and everyone else in-between, to join us! results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

The Conservancy is helping West Orange to construct an extension of the Lenape Trail on the northern border of the Reservation. We need a large turnout to continue clearing the trail we started in November (see a picture above). Unfortunately, we have had to reroute most of the trail in light of the wet areas revealed in the last month…so there is plenty of work to do!

Trail building is very satisfying, but can be hard work. We use hand tools such as picks and adzes to create and shape the trail tread. Wear shoes with solid soles and long pants…dress in layers. Meet at: In front of 2 Ellison Ave., West Orange. The trail goes south from there. For information, call John Verzani [masked]), or Dennis Percher [masked]).

results.description:
The hike begins in Heisteins Park and goes into the Black River Wildlife Management area. Then it continues along the Old Central Railroad and through Highland Ridge Park and into Seward Hill, which offers a 360 degree of Morris County. The Path then goes through the center of Chester and into Black River County Park with the ending in Palmer Park. This is a strenuous 10-15 mile hike on old railroad beds on paved and unpaved trails. Shuttle Required.
Patriots Path Map is at Morris Parks: http://www.morrisparks.net/maps/pdfs/PatriotsPath-2.pdf

Take Rt-206 south 4¾ mi. to light at the Bartley – Chester Rd (Rt-625) on the right. Turning onto Rt-625 continue West ½ mi to RR crossing. Rt-625 turns sharply left across RR tracks. Drive south 1½ mi to Palmer Park Entrance. Parking is straight ahead. Park Entrance GPS [masked], [masked])

results.description:
Hello! This is a Trip NOT to be Missed.

1st We will Tour the 911 Memorials Museum and NOT wait in the Long Long line W Priority Access.

https://www.911memorial.org/visit
Entering the museum, it’s immediately apparent how much effort and care went into it; the entire site is constructed to the highest order.
The museum is a homage to the Twin Towers themselves and their history, as well as to the events of 9/11 and its aftermath.

Its location is actually underground, beneath the plaza of the memorial—in fact, the walls of the fountains can be seen from inside the museum and there are exhibits to be seen underneath both fountains, which occupy the exact locations of each original tower.

2nd We will journey across to the the Brookfield Plaza, Lunch will be here on your own @ the

a http://brookfieldplaceny.com/directory/food

Located in Lower Manhattan's Battery Park City, a Fabulous and I do NYC Fabulous Its a great place for Shopping w  selection of World Class Eateries right on the Hudson! Perfect for Lunch

After Lunch

3rd Irish Hunger Memorial

http://bpcparks.org/whats-here/parks/irish-hunger-memorial/

The Memorial represents a rural Irish landscape with an abandoned stone cottage, stone walls, fallow potato fields and the flora on the north Connacht wetlands. It is both a metaphor for the Great Irish Famine and a reminder that hunger today is often the result of lack of access to land. The 96’ x 170’ Memorial, designed by artist Brian Tolle, contains stones from each of Ireland’s 32 counties, and is elevated on a limestone plinth. Along the base are bands of texts separated by layers of imported Kilkenny limestone.

4th We will Tour long-awaited Freedom Tower observatory https://oneworldobservatory.com/

Housed on floors 100, 101 and 102 of the nation’s tallest skyscraper, the One World Observatory will provide panoramic views and an “unparalleled opportunity to experience New York City,

We have Priority tickets Purchased in advance allows Us to visit the 9/11 Memorial Museum at Our preferred date and Time.

Please wear Comfortable shoes there is Plenty of walking !

http://www.history.com/topics/911-rebuilding-of-ground-zero

This Trip includes:

1.-RT Transposition on a  Luxury Bus {w Tolls and Tips}   and ALL Parking fees.

2. The 9 11 Memorial Museum fees

3. Freedom Tower observatory Fees

4.  For Only $96.00pp

 Robert Gilligan PO BOX 184, Ridgewood, NJ 07451


Questions? [masked]


Robert

DEPARTING 9:00am

Whole Foods Market

300 Bergen Town Center, Paramus, NJ

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
LEADER:  Chris Connolly ([masked] (pref.)[masked])

RATING: B 7 B

We’ll take the Schuber to loop around the MacMillan Reservoir, than take the Marsn and Yellow/Silver Trails to lunch view points, and return via Schuber and Silver Trails. Meet 9:30 AM at Ramapo Reservation Parking Lot off Rt. 202. TC North Jersey map 115.

* * * * * *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities. Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance.

Pace Ratings:
A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster
B = Moderate - about 2 mph
C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less

Distance:Noted in miles

Terrain Ratings:
A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents,
possible rock scrambling
B = Moderate climbs and descents
C = Generally flat with little elevation change

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling.

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike.

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

Risks: As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

Footwear and Clothing: Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes. Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

Drink and Food: Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

Other responsibilities: Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them. Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian. No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21. The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike. Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

Maps: The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

Abbreviations: NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

Expense Sharing: When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

Dog-Friendly Hikes: Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly." If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event). If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Drive to the second traffic light (the road makes a turn to the right and becomes a one way street called Essex Ave.). Turn right onto Lackawanna Place, go under the RR tracks, and you come almost immediately to Glen Ave. Across the street and a little to the right is a drive way entering the park with a sign "Locust Grove".

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree
results.name: Meditate

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans, 

After a drama-filled opening round at Melbourne, Formula One arrives in The Middle East for the Bahrain Grand Prix. This will be the third twilight race in Bahrain, with the race starting at sunset and ending in full darkness. The Bahrain International Circuit features a mix of slow-speed corners at the end of straights which makes it one of the most severe on brakes all season. 

The driver standings after the Australian Grand Prix we have race winner Nico Rosberg with 25 points, Lewis Hamilton second with 18 points and Sebastian Vettel third with 15 points. The constructor standings have Mercedes leading with 43 points, Ferrari second with 15 points and Williams just behind with 14 points.

TIRE ALLOCATION - As per new regulations, Pirelli has allocated three compounds: P Zero white medium, yellow soft and red supersoft tires (same as Australia). Once again, each driver is required to use two different compounds during the race.

DRS ZONES - There will be two DRS zones:  main-straight between turns 15 & 1 and back-straight between turns 10 & 11.


So can Lewis Hamilton redeem himself with his first win this season in Bahrain? Or will Nico Rosberg continue his winning streak? Or can Ferrari and Sebastian Vettel overtake both Mercedes drivers for victory? If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Bahrain Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 11:00AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 10:30AM EDT. It's going to be another exciting race. 

We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2016 Bahrain Grand Prix

results.description:
Platform program by Bart Worden, Leader of the Ethical Culture Society of Westchester.

It is a fact that Westchester County is extremely segregated in housing.  Of the 45 municipalities in the County, 22 had an African American population of less than 3%. By 2010 almost all of the municipalities' African American populations remained at about the same percentage or even declined.

There are significant barriers to African Americans who look to move into segregated areas in our County - -  cost and zoning are probably the most significant factors.  


In 2009, Westchester County settled with the United States Justice Department when faced with claims that the County had engaged in fraud in its compliance with fair housing (AFFH) guidelines that requires regions to identify, analyze, and take the steps necessary to overcome the barriers to fair housing choice.  In that consent decree, the County committed to take concrete steps to expand affordable housing by 750 units.  However, the current County administration has resisted  and the mandate under the consent decree may soon expire with little to show for it. 


Bart is an active participant with Westchester's Interfaith Clergy for Social Action and also with Community Voices Heard. These two social action organizations have been engaged in the struggle to enforce the consent decree.


Regular classes of Ethical Education for Children today.

9:30 - Colloquy - Self-reflection and meditation on a chosen subject within a nurturing, protected group environment.  Leader's Study.
results.name: Do Black Lives Matter in Housing in Westchester?

results.description:
Elisabeth Louise Vigée Le Brun (French, 1755–1842) 

Одна из наиболее выдающихся французских художниц 18 века. Великолепная техника живописи (Rococo) и элегантный стиль  поставили её  в ряд наиболее популярных портретистов Европы.

Ее кисти принадлежат портреты французской императрицаы Marie Antoinette, российской Елизаветы II, знатных особ Европы 18 века. Богатое творческое наследие художницы составляют 660 портретов и около 200 пейзажей.

Metropolitan Museum представит Вашему вниманию 80 работ выдающейся художницы.

Встречаемся около Information Desk на входе.

<a> </a>


<a> </a>


<a>
</a>

<a>https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louise_Élisabeth_Vigée_Le_Brun#/media/File%3AÉlisabeth-Louise_Vigée-Le_Brun_-_Madame_Vigée-Le_Brun_et_sa_fille_(1786).JPG </a>


http://www.metmuseum.org/exhibitions/listings/2016/vigee-le-brun


Elisabeth Louise Vigée Le Brun (French, 1755–1842) is one of the finest 18th-century French painters and among the most important of all women artists. An autodidact with exceptional skills as a portraitist, she achieved success in France and Europe during one of the most eventful, turbulent periods in European history.she was elected to membership in the Accademia di San Luca, Rome. Independently, she worked in Florence, Naples, Vienna, St. Petersburg, and Berlin 

 This is the first retrospective and only the second exhibition devoted to Vigée Le Brun in modern times.
results.name: Vigée Le Brun At Metropolitan Museum

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

results.description:
SHARE THIS EVENT FREELY & WIDELY ....

Veggie Pride Parade NYC 2016

9th annual

Confirmed date is Sun., Apr. 3, 2016

Parade route runs from Olde Meat District to Union Square Park.... 

The exact location of the line-up is 9th Ave at Gansevoort Street, which is just 2 short blocks south of W. 14th Street.

Parade line-up begins at 11 am. Parade launch takes place at Noon, sharp.

Parade participants are encouraged to dress up in costumes and wear sign boards announcing their pride in their vegan lifestyle. Local restaurants, veg groups, and veg everything will be represented with banners and chants. The parade will include animal-rights activists, environmentalists, and people simply concerned with their health. But at the next VEGGIE PRIDE PARADE, all will come together with one voice, one expression, of veggie pride.

http://www.veggieprideparade.org/

The parade culminates at Union Square Park (north plaza) at approximately 12:45 pm... in a festival for all to enjoy. (Festival goes until 5 pm....). There, revelers of all persuasions will hear well-known vegan speakers and music by vegan artists. They'll all partake in free vegan food and explore a wide variety of exhibitor presentations. At 2 p.m., a costume contest will take place.

Throughout the day, individuals will be encouraged to speak their mind at the Soapbox Testimonial Station. Other activists will beckon passersby to receive a dollar in return for watching a pro-veg video.

Organizer Pamela Rice feels confident that this year's parade will be the best ever. Ms. Rice said, "I'm hoping that at this event people will see vegans and vegetarians come out of the shadows, once and for all."

Visit http://www.veggieprideparade.org/  for more information about every aspect of the event.
results.name: Veggie Pride Parade NYC 2016

results.description:
-posted by Jennifer G.-

The 9th annual NYC Veggie Pride Parade will take place in Greenwich Village/Union Square, on Sunday, April 3, 2016.

If you're planning to attend, RSVP on this page—because it's nice to see who else from VLI is going.


You can use this page to coordinate plans with others. 

Here's the official parade info: 

Parade participants are encouraged to dress up in costumes and wear sign boards announcing their pride in their vegan lifestyle. Local restaurants, veg groups, and veg everything will be represented with banners and chants. The parade will include animal-rights activists, environmentalists, and people simply concerned with their health. But at the VEGGIE PRIDE PARADE, all will come together with one voice, one expression, of veggie pride.


Parade line-up begins at 11 a.m. The procession will begin at 12 noon, sharp, in the Old Meat Packing District (where 9th Ave. & Gansevoort St. intersect).  The parade will culminate at Union Square Park (north plaza) at approximately 12:45 pm...in a festival for all to enjoy. There, revelers of all persuasions will hear well-known vegan speakers and music by vegan artists. They'll all partake in free vegan food and explore a wide variety of exhibitor presentations. At 2 p.m., a costume contest will take place.

Throughout the day, individuals will be encouraged to speak their mind at the Soapbox Testimonial Station. Other activists will beckon passersby to receive a dollar in return for watching a pro-veg video.

You can register your attendance at the official Facebook event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/489874497879234/

Visit www.veggieprideparade.org for more information about every aspect of the event.

results.description:
The 9th Annual NYC Veggie Pride Parade, will take place in Greenwich Village/Union Square, on Sunday, April 3, 2016, starting at 12 noon. While it purports to march for veg*n "pride," really it is a march in support of veganism and animal rights. Vegetarians and Vegans are both very welcome to march. Our meetup group will have a large contingent there. The march ends in Union Square Park where there will be a rally with speakers, tables representing vegan and animal rights organizations, and free vegan food samples.


Where to Meet: Parade participants gather at the corner of 9th Avenue & Gansevoort Street. (Ironically and appropriately, this is in the "meatpacking district.") Our meetup group will be marching together as a group. At the intersection of 9th Ave. and Gansevoort St., several of our meetup group organizers will be holding "VEG MEETUP" signs. This is where we will all gather as a group, and from there, all go marching together. The line up begins at 11:00am, the parade launches at 12 noon. Please arrive between 11:00am and 11:15am.

Parade participants are encouraged to dress up in costumes, make and carry signs, or wear sign boards announcing their pride in their vegan lifestyle. Local restaurants, veg groups, and veg everything will be represented with banners and chants. The parade will include animal-rights activists, environmentalists, and people simply concerned with their health. But on April 3, 2016, all will come together with one voice, one expression, of veggie pride.

The procession will begin at 12 Noon, sharp, in the Old Meat Packing District (where 9th Ave. & Gansevoort St. intersect). It will culminate in a festival for all to enjoy at the north end of Union Square Park. There, revelers of all persuasions will hear well-known vegan speakers and music by vegan artists. They'll all partake in free vegan food and explore a wide variety of exhibitor presentations. At 2 p.m., a costume contest will take place.

Throughout the day, individuals will be encouraged to speak their mind at the Soapbox Testimonial Station. Other activists will beckon passersby to receive a dollar in return for watching a pro-veg video.

Organizer Pamela Rice feels confident that this year's parade will be the best ever. Ms. Rice said, "I'm hoping that at this event people will see vegans and vegetarians come out of the shadows, once and for all."


Visit www.veggieprideparade.org for more information about every aspect of the event.

Where to Meet: Parade participants gather at the corner of 9th Avenue & Gansevoort Street. (Ironically and appropriately, this is in the "meatpacking district.") Our meetup group will be marching together as a group.  At the intersection of 9th Ave. and Gansevoort St., several of our meetup group organizers will be holding "VEG MEETUP" signs.  This is where we will all gather as a group, and from there, all go marching together. The line up begins at 11:00am, the parade launches at 12 noon. Please arrive between 11:00am and 11:15am.

In addition to marching, our Meetup group will be tabling with animal rights and vegan advocacy literature before and after the parade. Would you like to help with this, at a time that works for you? If so, please click on my photo (David Greene) and send me a message through the Meetup.com system. Thank you!


Please RSVP on our event page here, and then come march with our meetup group on April 3rd. Thank you for your compassion and for marching for the animals!


David

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
